0.title: 126 lakes in B'luru overflowed in Sept due to heavy rains: BBMP
0.article_body: As many as 126 lakes overflowed in Bengaluru since the beginning of September due to heavy rains, according to Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike's (BBMP) data. Mahadevapura region is the worst affected with 42 lakes overflowing, followed by Bommanahalli (30 lakes). This could be the first time in several decades that so many lakes have overflowed, BBMP officials said.

1.title: Last reactor at Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant halts operation
1.article_body: Ukraine's atomic power operator Energoatom has said that the last reactor at Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant has been shut down after the plant was reconnected to the electricity grid. The plant, which has six reactors, was disconnected from the grid last week amidst fighting in the area. Energoatom urged Russia to allow creation of a "demilitarised zone" around Zaporizhzhia plant.

2.title: Woman dies after Redmi 6A explodes at night; YouTuber shares pics of damaged phone
2.article_body: A YouTuber from Haryana has claimed that his aunt died after Xiaomi's Redmi 6A smartphone exploded while she was sleeping at night. "She kept the phone near her face on pillow side and after sometime her phone [exploded]," Manjeet said. Xiaomi said it is trying to get in touch with the affected family and determine the cause of the incident.

3.title: Finished 'Delhi Crime 2' in one & a half days, was stuck to my iPad: Rakul
3.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh in a recent interview was asked to name the last series she binge-watched. The actress named Shefali Shah-starrer 'Delhi Crime 2' and said, "I finished it in 1 and a half days while I was shooting, while I was stuck in traffic, while I [was] coming back." "I was just stuck to my iPad," added Rakul.

4.title: We are ready to bat first if we lose the toss in Asia Cup final: Dasun Shanaka
4.article_body: Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said his side is ready to bat first if they lose the toss in their Asia Cup 2022 final against Pakistan today. "Toss is very important here, but our batsmen are very good," he stated. Sri Lanka have won all the matches in which they won the toss and opted to field in Asia Cup.

5.title: Will announce a new party in 10 days: Ghulam Nabi Azad in J&K
5.article_body: Ghulam Nabi Azad, who had earlier resigned from Congress, on Sunday said that he would announce a new political party in 10 days. Azad was addressing a public meeting in Baramulla, J&K. Earlier, Azad said, "I have not decided upon a name for my party yet. The people of J&K will decide the name and the flag for the party."

6.title: Peon molests 15-yr-old girl in Mumbai school toilet for 2 months
6.article_body: Police have arrested a 35-year-old peon for allegedly molesting a 15-year-old girl in a school toilet in Mumbai's Grant Road area since July. The accused befriended the victim and threatened her with dire consequences if she informed anyone. According to reports, the accused had taken her number and used to ask her to strip while on a video call.

7.title: 7.6-magnitude earthquake hits eastern Papua New Guinea, 3 dead
7.article_body: A 7.6-magnitude earthquake hit the eastern part of Papua New Guinea on Sunday, leaving three people dead. The earthquake damaged buildings, caused power outages and triggered landslides. Kessy Sawang, a member of parliament, said there are fears of more injuries and deaths due to the earthquake. Prime Minister James Marape expressed concern and urged people to move to higher ground.

8.title: We decided to wait on having a child due to COVID-19: Sonam Kapoor
8.article_body: Sonam Kapoor, speaking about planning to have a child with Anand Ahuja, revealed that they decided to wait during the COVID-19 pandemic as they did not understand much about it. Sonam revealed she told Anand on her birthday in 2021 that they should not wait anymore to have a child. The actress gave birth to a baby boy in August.

9.title: Queen Elizabeth's coffin makes 6-hour journey from her home to Edinburgh
9.article_body: The casket of Queen Elizabeth II is on a six-hour journey from her home in the Scottish Highlands to Edinburgh. The procession will give a chance to the public to pay tribute to the Queen. Princess Anne, Queen's daughter, is to accompany the procession. The Queen's state funeral will be held at Westminster Abbey in London on September 19.

10.title: Urvashi issues clarification over viral video after Naseem's 'I don't know her' remark
10.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela took to Instagram to issue a clarification over her viral video featuring Pakistan cricketer Naseem Shah after the latter stated he doesn't know who Urvashi is. "Couple of days back...my team shared...fan-made cute edits (around 11-12) without any knowledge of other people involved in it. Would kindly request...media to not create any sort of news," she wrote.

11.title: Harsha Bhogle names his Team of Asia Cup 2022, includes 2 Indians
11.article_body: Commentator Harsha Bhogle has named his Team of Asia Cup 2022. He has included four Pakistanis, two Indians, two Afghans and three Sri Lankans in his XI. He has named Virat Kohli and Bhuvneshwar Kumar in the team. Further, he has named Muhammad Rizwan as the opener and wicketkeeper. The team also includes Sri Lankan captain Dasun Shanaka.

12.title: Woman falls unconscious on flight from Dubai to Kochi, declared dead after landing
12.article_body: A 56-year-old woman fell unconscious on a flight from Dubai to Kochi on Saturday and was declared dead at a hospital in Kochi, police said on Sunday. "She was taken to a private hospital nearby after the flight landed but was declared dead," police said. Police haven't filed any case as the death was due to natural causes, reports said.

13.title: Pak are favourites to win Asia Cup but can't take the young SL lightly: Akram
13.article_body: Ahead of the Asia Cup 2022 final today, cricketer-turned-commentator Wasim Akram has said Pakistan are favourites to win the match but the "young" Sri Lankan team can't be taken lightly. "Pakistan's middle order...[was] exposed in the last game...hopefully, they come back stronger," added Wasim. Sri Lanka defeated Pakistan by five wickets in their Super 4 stage match on Friday.

14.title: Man creates 36 fake GST companies in Maharashtra, generates fake invoices worth ₹132 cr
14.article_body: A man in Maharashtra created 36 fake GST companies through which he generated fake invoices worth ₹132 crore and established network to pass-on fake Input Tax Credit of ₹23 crore. Officers of CGST Bhiwandi Commissionerate arrested him on Friday after conducting search operation at his residential premises. This is the 17th arrest by CGST Bhiwandi Commissionerate in last one year.

15.title: I'm sure I'll be in final again: Jabeur after losing in US Open 2022 final
15.article_body: After losing her second straight Grand Slam final at US Open 2022, Tunisian Ons Jabeur said, "Definitely I'm not someone that's going to give up." She added, "I'm sure I'm going to be in...final again. I'll try my best to win it." Top seed Iga Swiatek beat Jabeur 6-2, 7-6(7-5). Jabeur lost to Elena Rybakina in Wimbledon final in July.

16.title: 54,703 Ganesha idols immersed in PMC's mobile immersion tanks
16.article_body: As many as 54,703 Ganesha idols were immersed in Pune Municipal Corporation's mobile immersion tanks during this Ganpati festival. The PMC has spent ₹1.5 crore on mobile Ganesh immersion tanks and ₹275 for each immersion. Meanwhile, the Pune civic body collected 541,645 kg 'nirmalya' (flowers and leaves offered to the deity) this year.

17.title: 1,132 star turtles brought for sale to B'luru seized; 4 nomads arrested
17.article_body: Karnataka Police have arrested four nomads for possessing 1,132 star turtles and bringing them to the city to sell them. The accused stayed on fringes of forests in Andhra Pradesh and fetched the star turtles, a protected species under the Wildlife (Protection) Act 1972, from jungles. The accused told police they had sold 100 star turtles earlier in Mumbai.

18.title: Talking about Rahul's t-shirt shows BJP's intellectual bankruptcy: Patole
18.article_body: Congress leader Nana Patole said that talking about party leader Rahul Gandhi's t-shirt shows BJP's "intellectual bankruptcy". "What about [PM] Modi who wears suit [worth] ₹10 lakh and glasses [worth] ₹1.5 lakh?" Patole asked. His statement came after BJP shared a picture of Rahul wearing a Burberry t-shirt, which purportedly costs ₹41,257, while on Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'.

19.title: 19-yr-old boy kidnaps, rapes 14-yr-old girl in Gurugram; arrested
19.article_body: Police have arrested a 19-year-old boy for allegedly kidnapping and raping a 14-year-old girl in Gurugram, according to a report. As per the police, the suspect, who is said to be the girl's neighbour, had been forcing her to marry him. He was produced in a court on Saturday and sent to judicial custody.

20.title: Islamic State affiliate killed 30 civilians in Mali: Militia
20.article_body: A coalition of pro-government militia has said that an Islamic State affiliate in Mali killed about 30 civilians in an attack on a town in the area bordering Burkina Faso and Niger. In the incident, hundreds of militants attacked the coalition's fighters, forcing them to retreat, it added. "Reinforcements...reached the town where they discovered the massacre," it further said.

21.title: Still open to other partners: Ubisoft CEO over deal with Tencent
21.article_body: French video game maker Ubisoft is still open to other partners, CEO Yves Guillemot said after the company announced that Tencent will soon become Ubisoft's single biggest shareholder with an overall stake of 11%. The deal values Ubisoft at about $10 billion. "We remain totally independent and we can act with any outside company if we want to," Guillemot said.

22.title: Woman slaps security guard of Noida housing society several times, video surfaces
22.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a woman repeatedly slapping a security guard of a housing society in Noida. According to reports, the woman who slapped the guard is a professor by profession and the incident has been reported to police. Last month, a video showing a Noida woman assaulting a guard over delay in opening society gates surfaced.

23.title: Gauri Khan to appear on 'Koffee With Karan 7' finale episode: Reports
23.article_body: Karan Johar will reportedly host Shah Rukh Khan's wife and producer Gauri Khan in the finale episode of 'Koffee With Karan 7'. Reportedly, Gauri agreed to come on the show on the condition that Karan won't ask any questions about Aryan's arrest in the Mumbai cruise drugs case. Gauri will also be joined by Bhavana Pandey and Maheep Kapoor.

24.title: Aus' Peers-Sanders win their maiden mixed doubles Grand Slam title at US Open
24.article_body: Australian pair of John Peers and Storm Sanders won their first-ever Grand Slam mixed doubles title at US Open on Saturday. The fourth seeds beat unseeded duo of Kirsten Flipkens and Edouard Roger-Vasselin 4-6, 6-4,[10-7] in the final. With this, Peers and Sanders became the first Australian duo in 21 years to win the US Open mixed doubles title.

25.title: Institutions need to produce students capable of getting into industry: FM
25.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday said India needs to understand what the industry requires and educational institutions need to produce students capable of getting into the industry to serve the country's development goals. Sitharaman while addressing a convocation event said that India’s higher education was no less when compared to global universities.

26.title: 4 new satellite towns to come up around Bengaluru soon: CM Bommai
26.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai announced that the government is planning to build four satellite towns around Bengaluru and six integrated towns in the state. Devanahalli, Nelamangala, Doddaballapur and one other town will be developed as satellite towns, he said. "Population is showing exponential growth and there is a need to create infrastructure for connecting Bengaluru," he added.

27.title: Wanted Kareena to play Swara's role in 'Jahaan Chaar Yaar': Producer
27.article_body: 'Jahaan Chaar Yaar' producer Vinod Bachchan said he wanted Kareena Kapoor Khan to play the lead role in the film. "We sent the script to her talent management agency, but didn't get any response," he said. Bachchan added he later realised that the part "didn't need a top star but a talented performer" and Swara Bhasker fits the role.

28.title: Apple, Google completely inhibited competition: Mexico's ex-telecom chief
28.article_body: Mexico's former telecom chief Mony de Swaan Addati has accused Apple and Google of "completely (inhibiting) competition". In a complaint filed with Mexico's telecom regulator IFT, Addati said they do this by "taking advantage of their monopoly in app stores to tie use of their own payment processing systems for in-app purchases". Play Store and App Store charge 15-20% commission.

29.title: Buses were never purchased: AAP on LG's approval for CBI probe
29.article_body: After Delhi LG VK Saxena approved a Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) probe into the alleged corruption in the procurement of 1,000 low-floor buses by Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC), AAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj stated that the buses were never purchased. Bharadwaj further said the CBI had registered a preliminary enquiry and the agency could not find anything a year ago.

30.title: 16-year-old YouTuber 'Bindass Kavya' missing from Maharashtra found in train coach in MP
30.article_body: A 16-year-old YouTuber 'Bindass Kavya', reported missing from Maharashtra, was found in a train coach at Itarsi railway station in Madhya Pradesh, an official said. The Government Railway Police received information that she left home after being scolded by her parents. The GRP found her in a sleeper coach of the Kushinagar Express and handed her over to her family.

31.title: Google changes its logo to grey to pay tribute to Queen Elizabeth II
31.article_body: Google has replaced its vibrant homepage logo to grey to pay tribute to Queen Elizabeth II, Britain's longest-serving monarch, who died aged 96 on September 8. Google changed its logo in the UK soon after the announcement of the Queen's death. Condoling her demise, Google CEO Sundar Pichai wrote, "Her steadfast leadership...[has] been a constant through many of our lifetimes."

32.title: Smaller cities with own economies only solution to avoid disasters: Zerodha CEO
32.article_body: Bengaluru-based Zerodha's CEO Nithin Kamath said the "only real solution" to avoid disasters in large Indian cities is to "have many smaller cities with their own economies". He tweeted, "Most large Indian cities weren't built...to handle as many people living in them today." Kamath's statement comes after flooding in Bengaluru prompted many people to travel to office on tractors recently.

33.title: We didn't adequately celebrate achievements of Indian scientists: PM
33.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has said that the accomplishments of Indian scientists during the last century were not celebrated adequately. He was virtually inaugurating the Centre-State Science Conclave at Gujarat Science City on Saturday. "The celebration of...small and big achievements of the Indian scientists will create a leaning towards science and will help us in this 'Amrit Kal'," he said.

34.title: Filmmaker Rajiv Rai makes comeback after 18 years with 'Zora'
34.article_body: Director Rajiv Rai, who has previously helmed films such as 'Tridev' (1989), 'Mohra' (1994) and 'Gupt' (1997), is returning to filmmaking after 18 years with "whodunnit suspense murder mystery", titled 'Zora'. Calling it an "ambitious venture", Rajiv said the film "was experimental in every way". He said it will introduce 40 new actors from diverse regions of India.

35.title: Mastermind behind China-linked shell firms arrested while trying to flee India
35.article_body: The Serious Fraud Investigation Office has arrested a man believed to be the mastermind behind racket involving incorporation of large number of shell companies with Chinese links in India. The man, identified as Dorste, was arrested in Gaya while trying to escape India, the Ministry of Corporate Affairs said. The arrest comes after the Ministry conducted search and seizure operations.

36.title: Support to 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' has left BJP shocked: Ashok Gehlot
36.article_body: Rajasthan CM and Congress leader Ashok Gehlot said that the public support for Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' has left the BJP shocked. "It is very surprising that the statements made by…Amit Shah in Jodhpur...are factually incorrect," Gehlot said. His remark came after Shah in Jodhpur said that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi needs to study the country’s history first.

37.title: My mother slept in middle of ‘Tumbbad’ premiere at Venice: Sohum Shah
37.article_body: Sohum Shah revealed that his mother "slept in the middle" of 'Tumbbad' at its premiere at the Venice Film Festival. He recalled when she came out, she asked him about the kind of films he was making. Talking about his career, Shah said he wanted to do commercial films, but only 'Maharani' turned out to be his "most massy project".

38.title: Congress sends 10 dosas to Tejasvi Surya after viral video amid B'luru flood
38.article_body: Members of Karnataka Congress sent 10 different dosas from Bengaluru's popular restaurants to BJP leader Tejasvi Surya alleging that he is only worried about the popularity of restaurants and not about people. Earlier, Congress shared a purported video of the Bengaluru south MP enjoying a masala dosa at a local eatery during Bengaluru floods and called him apathetic.

39.title: Disney CEO rejects billionaire Loeb's call to sell or spin off ESPN
39.article_body: Walt Disney CEO Bob Chapek has rejected billionaire activist investor Daniel Loeb's call to sell or spin off ESPN. Chapek added that earlier this year, Disney saw interest from companies seeking to buy the network. "If everyone wants to come in and buy it or spin it with us, I think that says something about its potential," Chapek added.

40.title: You can experiment in bilateral series but not in Asia Cup: Vengsarkar
40.article_body: Ex-Team India chief selector Dilip Vengsarkar has criticised Team India management for "experiments" with the playing XI combination in "big tournaments" like the Asia Cup 2022. "You can experiment maybe in a bilateral series, but the Asia Cup and the World Cup, these are major tournaments. In these tournaments, you need to win," he stated.

41.title: Growing up, thought chronic anxiety was normal: Bella Hadid
41.article_body: Model Bella Hadid said that growing up, she thought having chronic anxiety was normal and didn't realise she needed therapy. Hadid also spoke about suffering from body dysmorphia during her early days of modelling. "During that part of my life, I was so out of body, disassociating so much...I was so confused by what people saw of me," she said.

42.title: 'Brahmāstra' earns over ₹160 crore worldwide in 2 days
42.article_body: The makers of Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt starrer 'Brahmāstra Part One: Shiva' have announced that their two-day box office collection worldwide has crossed ₹160 crore. "Thank you to all our audiences, for spreading Love and Light in Cinemas this weekend," the makers tweeted. The film opened at worldwide gross collection of ₹75 crore, the makers had announced on Saturday.

43.title: We forcefully played in wet conditions: Harmanpreet on 9-wicket loss to England
43.article_body: India Women captain Harmanpreet Kaur said they were not able to get the runs they were expecting in the first T20I against England as they "forcefully played" in wet conditions. "Conditions were not 100 per cent fit to play," stated Harmanpreet. Notably, India's Radha Yadav picked up a shoulder injury while fielding and left the field during the game.

44.title: India can become a powerhouse driving global growth by 2047: Goyal
44.article_body: While addressing the business community of Southern California, Union Minister for Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal said the Confederation of Indian Industry estimated that India will be a $35-45 trillion economy in 2047. "India...in 2047 can be seen as a powerhouse driving global growth," Goyal added. Goyal invited the business community to invest in India during the nation's "golden period".

45.title: Mumbai college principal booked for casteist remarks against student
45.article_body: The principal of a Mumbai college has been booked for allegedly making casteist remarks against a student. The student in her complaint stated she was humiliated in front of the entire class. The prosecution also alleged that the accused sent an objectionable link to students. However, the principal said that the link was part of the curriculum on sex education.

46.title: 6.1 magnitude earthquake hits Indonesia; 200 evacuated, 1 injured
46.article_body: About 200 people were evacuated to higher ground after an earthquake of magnitude 6.1 hit the islands in western Indonesia on Sunday, according to the country's national disaster management agency. One person was injured by falling wood and some properties were damaged due to the earthquake, the agency said. There was no danger of a tsunami.

47.title: 12 kg gold worth ₹5.38 cr being smuggled in belt seized at Mumbai airport
47.article_body: Mumbai Airport Customs has seized 12 kg gold worth over ₹5.38 crore being smuggled in a specially designed belt worn by a Sudanese national. Passengers who were part of the group created a commotion to help the accused escape but were overpowered by authorities. A total of six passengers have been detained and six others are being deported, officials stated.

48.title: Warden arrested for sexually assaulting 7 minor boys at Hyd school
48.article_body: A warden has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting seven minor boys at the hostel of Sri Chaitanya school in Hyderabad. The police said that the accused reportedly targeted minors due to "sexual frustration" as he was unmarried. The accused, who was sent on remand, apparently used to sleep alongside the boys and would touch them inappropriately while they slept.

49.title: Admit cards with PM Modi, Dhoni pics issued in university in Bihar
49.article_body: Several students from colleges affiliated to Bihar's Lalit Narayan Mithila University were issued admit cards which had photographs of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and cricketer Mahendra Singh Dhoni. "Students were supposed to upload photographs...[they] seem to have engaged in irresponsible mischief," the university's registrar said, adding that students have been issued show cause notices.

50.title: Clarification, not confrontation: Tharoor after leak of private letter by 5 MPs
50.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor reacted to the letter that five Congress MPs (including Tharoor) wrote to Madhusudan Mistry, head of Congress' internal poll panel, which was allegedly leaked leading to controversy. Taking to Twitter, Tharoor wrote, "I spoke with...Mistry ji...to end the unseemly controversy...I stressed that as loyal Congressmen we were seeking clarification, not confrontation."

51.title: UK PM to join King Charles on Britain tour to lead mourning for Queen
51.article_body: UK PM Liz Truss will accompany King Charles on a tour of Britain's four nations - England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland, as he will lead mourning for the Queen, Truss' spokesperson said. In a special Parliament session, Truss swore new oath of allegiance to the new King. Truss was present when Charles was officially proclaimed as Britain's new King.

52.title: Switzerland plans to open nuclear waste storage unit near German border
52.article_body: Switzerland's National Cooperative for the Disposal of Radioactive Waste proposed a plan to build a nuclear waste storage facility on the German border. The waste would be sourced from five nuclear power plants and would be embedded several hundred metres underground. Local German communities along the border are concerned about the issues of safety and drinking water supply, reports said.

53.title: I did not follow 12-14 hours study schedules: JEE Advanced topper Shishir
53.article_body: After topping JEE Advanced 2022 exam with 314 marks out of 360, RK Shishir of IIT Bombay zone said that he did not put 12-14 hours into his studies which is a common practice. Stating that he has been consistently studious, Shishir added that it is not the number of hours but the quality that matters while cracking entrance exams.

54.title: Which startups have seen the biggest drop in valuations in 2022 as per Hurun?
54.article_body: China-based Douyin, the owner of TikTok, saw the sharpest decline in its valuation in the last six months, as it fell by $150 billion to $200 billion, as per Hurun. Fintech startups Klarna, Stripe and Ant Group's valuation dropped by $39.5 billion, $33 billion, and $30 billion, respectively. The drop in valuations comes amid global economy slowdown and high inflation.

55.title: Shouldn't all Raj Bhavans become Kartavya Bhavans?: Tharoor on renaming Rajpath
55.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor, while reacting to the renaming of the Rajpath, on Saturday said, "If Rajpath is to be renamed 'Kartavya Path', shouldn't all Raj Bhavans become Kartavya Bhavans?" Tharoor tweeted, "Why stop there? Rename Rajasthan as Kartavyasthan?" Earlier, the Centre announced that the Rajpath and Central Vista lawns area would be renamed 'Kartavya Path'.

56.title: I was one of the people who took decision to make Shinde CM: Fadnavis
56.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis during an interview said that he knew that Eknath Shinde would become the state CM because he was one of the people who took this decision. Fadnavis said this on being questioned about his post as Deputy CM. Adding that the post "doesn't matter", he said, "Whatever responsibility we get in...BJP, we fulfil that."

57.title: Delhi teachers propose specialised govt school for kids with violent tendencies
57.article_body: The Government School Teachers Association (GSTA) has proposed the Delhi government to set up specialised schools for students with "violent and criminal tendencies". The GSTA has also requested the presence of one police personnel inside school premises during school hours, a threefold increase in the strength of guards in schools and capping the student strength of schools to 2,500.

58.title: 5 Bihar policemen locked in jail for 2 hours for 'dissatisfactory work'; video surfaces
58.article_body: A video of five police officers being kept inside a lockup in Bihar's Nawada has surfaced online. Bihar Police Association has sought a probe into the incident after it was reported that three assistant sub-inspectors and two sub-inspectors were kept inside the lockup for two hours on the orders of SP Gaurav Mangla because he was dissatisfied with their performance.

59.title: India won't go to T20 World Cup as favourites: RP Singh
59.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh has said India won't go to the T20 WC 2022 as favourites to win the title. "If you really want to earn that trophy, you need to...back the 11-12 players in the upcoming games against Australia and South Africa," he added. "If you continue to shuffle, it will only cause more confusion," Singh further said.

60.title: Unable to see in dark, Gurugram delivery executive hits truck with bike; dies
60.article_body: A 27-year-old delivery executive was killed after his motorcycle allegedly rammed into a stationary truck in Gurugram's DLF Phase 1 on Friday. The man was with his relative but the two were travelling on separate motorcycles. "Since it was dark and the truck did not have any reflector lights on, he did not spot [the truck]," the deceased's relative said.

61.title: Delhi LG approves CBI probe in procurement of buses by Delhi govt
61.article_body: Delhi LG VK Saxena has cleared a proposal to forward a complaint to CBI to probe the alleged corruption in the procurement of 1,000 low-floor buses by the AAP-led state government. The complaint alleges that the Minister of Transport being appointed as chairman of the committee for procuring buses by Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) was done in a "premeditated manner".

62.title: New Vande Bharat gets safety nod, likely to be flagged off on Sept 30
62.article_body: The new Vande Bharat high-speed train is likely to be flagged off on September 30 as it has already completed its 20-day trial run and received Commission of Railway Safety's (CRS) approval, officials said. The Vande Bharat-2 is likely to run between Mumbai and Ahmedabad and it will be flagged off by PM Narendra Modi, senior officials said.

63.title: 1 killed, 20 injured after fire breaks out in Surat chemical factory; 3 people missing
63.article_body: One worker was killed while 20 others were injured in a fire that broke out at Anupam Rasayan India Limited factory in Gujarat's Surat on Saturday. Reports said three people are currently missing. Surat in-charge Chief Fire Officer Basant Pareek said the fire started after a massive blast in a container storing hazardous chemicals.

64.title: I'd go with Pant at no. 5, Hardik at no. 6 & Karthik at no. 7: Pujara
64.article_body: India batter Cheteshwar Pujara has said with the kind of Asia Cup Team India had, they need both Rishabh Pant and Dinesh Karthik in the playing XI for the T20 World Cup. "I'd go with Rishabh at number five, Hardik at number six and Karthik at number 7. Unless you're looking for Hooda to bowl a few overs," stated Pujara.

65.title: Regularise temporary employees: Kejriwal urges Centre, States
65.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday hailed the Punjab government for regularising 8,736 school teachers and urged the central and state governments to make temporary employees permanent. "People working as temporary employees are right at the bottom of the hierarchy and are the poorest. They are exploited. It is time to end their exploitation," Kejriwal stated.

66.title: Cab aggregators need to set clear policy on surge pricing: CCI
66.article_body: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has proposed self-regulatory steps for cab aggregators on surge pricing and revenue sharing. It said cab aggregators should provide customers with general description of various components of total fare mentioning the surge. In case of rude cancellation, drivers should be notified what part of cancellation charge is given to them, the CCI said.

67.title: Will continue our fight democratically for restoration of Article 370: Omar
67.article_body: National Conference leader Omar Abdullah said his party will continue fighting "democratically, constitutionally and politically" for the restoration of Article 370, which was abrogated by the Centre. "We're not on the roads or misleading the public or taking the law in our hands for restoration of Article 370," Abdullah added. "I'm not among those who will give up," he stated.

68.title: Rahul going on 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' wearing foreign t-shirt: Amit Shah
68.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said Congress' Rahul Gandhi is out to unite the country wearing a "foreign t-shirt". Addressing a BJP workers' gathering in Jodhpur, Shah said, "Rahul baba is going on 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' wearing a foreign t-shirt." Earlier, BJP shared a picture of Rahul wearing a Burberry t-shirt, which purportedly costs ₹41,257, while on yatra.

69.title: Delhi civic body allows permits for street vendors to return to India Gate
69.article_body: The New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) has begun the process to allow around 120 street vendors to operate in the redeveloped Central Vista Avenue and its surrounding areas. The vendors will return to the India Gate area 20 months after they were removed due to the redevelopment work. Vendors will be restricted to specially earmarked vending zones, an official stated.

70.title: They’ve done fantastic job: Kit Harington on 'House of the Dragon'
70.article_body: Actor Kit Harington said he is "really enjoying" watching 'House of the Dragon'. He said the makers of 'Game of Thrones' spinoff have "done a fantastic job". "It's a weird one to start a whole new show in the same kind of realm and to make it its own thing, and I think that they've really done that," he said.

71.title: Women tell Rahul they'll marry him to Tamil girl; Jairam shares pic of leader's reaction
71.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said that during Rahul Gandhi's interaction with women MGNREGA workers in Tamil Nadu's Marthandam, a lady told Rahul they are ready to get him married to a Tamil girl. "RG looks most amused & the photo shows it," Jairam Ramesh wrote in his tweet with the picture. Rahul met the MGNREGA workers during Bharat Jodo Yatra.

72.title: Deepak wins award for 'Good Luck...', says people watched it for Janhvi
72.article_body: Deepak Dobriyal won the Best Actor in a Comic Role for 'Good Luck Jerry' at the OTTPlay Awards 2022. He dedicated his award to his co-star Janhvi Kapoor and said people watched the film because of her. "Janhvi's hold on the youth and her fan following meant people watched this film. That's why I got this award," he said.

73.title: Took time for my brain to work again: Eminem on 2007 drug overdose
73.article_body: Rapper Eminem said it "took a long time" for his brain to start working after his drug overdose in 2007. He was hospitalised in 2007 after overdosing on methadone before going into rehab. Eminem said he "was so scatter-brained" that people thought he might have injured or damaged his brain. "I was in this weird fog for months," he added.

74.title: RK Shishir tops JEE Advanced 2022, Tanishka Kabra topper among girl candidates
74.article_body: RK Shishir of IIT Bombay zone has topped JEE Advanced 2022 exam with 314 marks out of 360. Tanishka Kabra of IIT Delhi zone has topped the exam among the girl candidates with 277 marks. After Shishir, Polu Lakshmi Sai Lohith Reddy was ranked second, Thomas Biju Cheeramvelil ranked third, Vangapalli Sai Siddhartha ranked fourth and Mayank Motwani ranked fifth.

75.title: UP CM suspends 15 officials after fire kills 4 at Lucknow's Hotel Levana
75.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has suspended 15 officials after four people were killed in a fire that broke out in Hotel Levana in Lucknow. Earlier, a probe report had suggested action against officers and engineers. The report also held six departments including Fire Services and the Excise Department responsible for the fire.

76.title: Delhi records 7th monkeypox case as 24-yr-old woman tests positive
76.article_body: Delhi has recorded its seventh case of Monkeypox. A 24-year-old female of Nigerian origin has tested positive. Dr Vineet Rehlan, nodal officer for monkeypox cases and professor of dermatology at Delhi's Lok Nayak hospital, said the patient has been living in India for last four months and had visited the hospital with symptoms such as fever, sore throat and blisters.

77.title: 4 lakh people travel by Hyd metro on Sept 9 during Ganesh Visarjan
77.article_body: According to metro officials, a total of four lakh passengers used the metro services in Hyderabad on the occasion of Ganesh Visarjan on September 9. The officials said that about 40,000 passengers exited and 22,500 passengers entered the Khairatabad metro station. Earlier, Hyderabad Metro Rail had announced that the service will remain open till 2 am for Ganesh Visarjan.

78.title: 'Sanaa' is going to be unforgettable part of my journey: Radhika
78.article_body: Actress Radhika Madan, who has started dubbing for her upcoming film 'Sanaa', called the film "an unforgettable part" of her journey as an actor. Director Sudhanshu Saria said Radhika "went to lengths to embody Sanaa to the best of her calibre" and he "can't imagine any other actor" playing the character. The film also stars Pooja Bhatt and Sohum Shah.

79.title: Ajinkya Rahane scores double ton on return to competitive cricket
79.article_body: West Zone captain Ajinkya Rahane played an unbeaten 207-run innings on his return to competitive cricket after a gap of almost four months. Rahane along with opener Yashasvi Jaiswal scored double hundreds against North East Zone in their ongoing Duleep Trophy quarter-finals match. Rahane had picked a groin injury in IPL 2022 and hadn't played since then.

80.title: Traffic diversions in Pune's Chandani chowk from tomorrow due to bridge demolition
80.article_body: The Pune Traffic Police have placed traffic regulations and diversions at Chandani chowk from tomorrow for demolition of an old bridge in the junction. The demolition will start from Monday (September 12) and will be completed in a phased manner before September 16. According to the advisory, traffic from Mumbai to Kothrud will be diverted via the existing Kothrud route.

81.title: Mysuru MP visits site after Volvo bus skids on B'luru-Mysuru expressway
81.article_body: After a goods truck fell on its side and a Volvo bus carrying passengers skidded but avoided a major mishap on the Bengaluru-Mysuru Expressway, Mysuru-Kodagu MP Pratap Simha visited the accident site. A video of the truck lying on the side of the expressway had earlier gone viral. Several people had shared the video and had expressed their concerns.

82.title: Wow, that's a new low: Kangana on 'Brahmāstra' figures being 70% fake
82.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut has shared filmmaker Eray Mridula Cather's tweet which called the box office figures of Ayan Mukerji directorial 'Brahmāstra' to be 60-70% fake. Kangana wrote alongside a screenshot of the tweet, "Wow!!! That's a new low." Eray tweeted, "Few trade analysts are not giving #Brahmastra BO figures as they're completely manipulated...It's not just ego, it's coke-ego!"

83.title: Pic shows Tricolour flying at half-mast as India observes 1-day state mourning
83.article_body: The Tricolour is being flown at half-mast at Red Fort, Rashtrapati Bhavan, Parliament and other government buildings on Sunday as India observes one-day state mourning following the demise of UK Queen Elizabeth II. There will be no official entertainment on Sunday, according to the statement released by the Centre. The Queen passed away on September 8.

84.title: Players carry stretcher after fan suffers heart attack during Cadiz-Barca match
84.article_body: Barcelona's La Liga match against Cadiz on Saturday night was suspended for over 50 minutes after a fan suffered a cardiac arrest in the stands. Cadiz players Jose Mari and Jeremias Ledesma were seen assisting the officials in carrying a stretcher and a defibrillator during the medical emergency. Cadiz said the fan was successfully resuscitated and taken to the hospital.

85.title: Around 1,50,000 people visited revamped Central Vista yesterday: Police
85.article_body: As the revamped Central Vista Avenue was opened to public on Thursday evening after almost 19 months, a large number of people visited India Gate yesterday. Around 1,50,000 people visited the avenue on Saturday, of whom 40,000 arrived after sunset, the police officers estimated. Parking spaces were full in the evening as a huge crowd turned up, DCP Traffic said.

86.title: 'UP + Bihar = Gayi Modi Sarkar' poster surfaces outside SP's office in Lucknow
86.article_body: A poster surfaced in Lucknow outside the Samajwadi Party's (SP) office with photos of Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and SP chief Akhilesh Yadav. "UP + Bihar = Gayi Modi Sarkar (If UP and Bihar join hands, PM Modi-led government will be ousted)," read message on the poster. "If we see political map, BJP would be nowhere," SP's IP Singh said.

87.title: Canadian Parliament to pay tribute to Queen Elizabeth II on Thursday
87.article_body: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said the Parliament will sit on Thursday to allow members to pay tribute to Queen Elizabeth II. "In addition, to accommodate Her Majesty's funeral, the opening of the session will be delayed by one day to September 20th," Trudeau added. In a previous tweet, Trudeau said the Queen was thoughtful, curious, helpful and funny.

88.title: Bus collides with tanker truck carrying fuel in Mexico; 18 killed
88.article_body: At least 18 people were killed after a bus collided with a tanker truck carrying fuel on a highway in Mexico's Tamaulipas, according to authorities. The crash left both vehicles completely burned and pictures released by the police showed that the bus was reduced to charred metal, the Associated Press reported. The truck driver apparently survived and is being investigated.

89.title: Payments giants to apply code to track sales at gun stores in US
89.article_body: Visa Inc, Mastercard Inc and American Express have said that they will implement a new merchant category code, approved by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO), for US gun retailers. Gun-control activists said that the code will track purchase of suspicious weapons. The code will show where an individual has spent money but won't show the items purchased.

90.title: IIT JEE Advanced 2022 results declared
90.article_body: The Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay (IIT Bombay) has released the results for the Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) Advanced 2022 exam. Candidates can now check their score cards at the official JEE Advanced website - jeeadv.ac.in.  The online registration for Architecture Aptitude Test (AAT) 2022 will be open from 10 am of September 11 till 5 pm of September 12.

91.title: Veteran actor & former Union Minister Krishnam Raju passes away aged 83
91.article_body: Veteran actor and former Union Minister U Krishnam Raju has passed away at the age of 83 while undergoing treatment at a Hyderabad hospital. Known as 'Rebel Star', he acted in over 180 films and was a two-time Lok Sabha member. Condoling his demise, Home Minister Amit Shah tweeted, "His passing away leaves a deep void in our Telugu cinema."

92.title: Mumbai Police bust child begging racket after baby kidnapped from station
92.article_body: A woman and her two children have been taken into custody after allegedly kidnapping a baby from Mumbai's Dadar railway station. Police checked CCTV footage as part of their probe and busted a child begging racket. The incident came to light after the baby's mother filed a missing complaint with the Borivali Government Railway Police (GRP).

93.title: India reports 5,076 new COVID-19 cases, daily positivity rate stands at 1.58%
93.article_body: India has reported 5,076 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours and 11 more deaths, according to the Union Health Ministry. This comes a day after the country recorded 5,554 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in the country stood at 47,945, while the daily positivity rate stood at 1.58%.

94.title: Chandigarh admin fined ₹10,000 by HC, sought more jail term for drug convict
94.article_body: The Punjab and Haryana High Court fined the Chandigarh administration ₹10,000 for seeking enhancement of jail term for a drug seizure case convict who remained in jail for two months. The court observed that the convict had no prior arrests and was found in possession of 210 grams of charas which is not a commercial quantity.

95.title: 40 students fall sick at TN school, dead lizard reportedly found in food
95.article_body: A cook and an assistant cook were suspended after over 40 students complained of nausea and vomiting after eating a midday meal at a government school in Tamil Nadu's Tiruvannamalai. The police said that the students had reportedly found a dead lizard in the food. Six of the students who fell sick were referred to a government hospital.

96.title: Woman, lover strangle husband to death, pass it as cardiac arrest in Ludhiana
96.article_body: A woman and her lover allegedly strangled her husband to death after he found out about their affair and tried to pass it off as cardiac arrest in Ludhiana. She mixed intoxicants in the victim's tea who lost consciousness, following which her lover strangled him. The accused switched off the CCTV cameras installed in the house before committing the crime.

97.title: Who’ll take his talks seriously, he was with BJP a month ago: Kishor on Bihar CM
97.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor, on being asked about Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's displeasure with him stating BJP links, said, “Nitishji isn't angry with me, it's his way of speaking.” “Who'll take his talks seriously? He was with BJP...month ago,” Kishor added. Earlier, Kumar, while responding to a question about Kishor said, “Maybe he wants to stay with BJP…help them.”

98.title: Govt refuses to share details on Agnipath scheme under RTI, says file marked 'secret'
98.article_body: The government has refused to share details about the Agnipath scheme for military recruitment under the Right to Information, saying the file has been marked "secret", according to a Defence Ministry letter. Information was sought on the inter-ministerial deliberations and reasons for introducing Agnipath to replace the existing recruitment scheme and discussion on the pay package and allowance.

99.title: Wealthy tech elite looked the other way: Zoho CEO on video of homeless fighting in US
99.article_body: Responding to a viral video of a massive fight that broke out between homeless people in San Francisco, US, Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu said, "The tragedy of San Francisco is...its wealthy tech elite have looked the other way." He further said, "The tragedy of the world is that...same tech elite is pushing the ideology on...us, calling everyone who resists bigots."

100.title: I have 4 times more supporters now: Azad post all-party meet
100.article_body: Former Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad convened an all-party meeting in Jammu on Saturday and claimed that delegations from 30-35 Assembly constituencies extended their support to him and will be part of whatever party he makes. "I can safely say that four times more people have come to my support than to the meetings I held in Congress," Azad said.

101.title: 5 die in Haridwar after consuming liquor given by panchayat poll candidate
101.article_body: Five people died in two villages of Haridwar on Saturday allegedly after consuming liquor that was distributed by a panchayat poll candidate, police said. Several people were hospitalised and some of them are stated to be in serious condition, police added. However, a report from CMO said initial inquiries have ruled out consumption of illicit liquor as cause of death.

102.title: KRK shares 1st tweet after release from jail, says 'I'm back for my vengeance'
102.article_body: Actor Kamaal R Khan, who was arrested over derogatory tweet and molestation cases after he landed in Mumbai last month, has shared his first tweet after being released on bail. "I am back for my vengeance," KRK tweeted. Earlier, his son Faisal tweeted from KRK's Twitter account and alleged, "Some people are torturing to kill my father in Mumbai."

103.title: I don't like Swiatek very much right now, but it's okay: Jabeur
103.article_body: World number five Ons Jabeur jokingly said she doesn't like Iga Swiatek after losing to the latter in their women's singles final at the US Open 2022. "I really tried...but Iga didn't make it easy for me...I don't like her very much right now, but it's okay," she said. It was Jabeur's second straight defeat in a Grand Slam final.

104.title: 2,000 sq km of Ukraine's territory liberated since early Sept: Zelenskyy
104.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday said that about 2,000 square kilometre of the country's territory has been liberated since the beginning of September. This comes as Russia's Defence Ministry announced it will pull back troops from areas in Kharkiv amid Kyiv's counteroffensive. "In the end, it is a good choice for [Russia] to run away," Zelenskyy added.

105.title: I used to feel Karan Johar is a misfit, but now I identify with him: Anurag
105.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap stated that he initially used to feel filmmaker Karan Johar is a misfit. "The more I have discovered him, I love him a lot. I identify with him...on many things in life," Anurag added. He further said that Karan is constantly trying to change himself, adapt to situations and produce films for the younger lot.

106.title: Instagram is an envy amplifier: World's richest person Elon Musk
106.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk on Sunday tweeted, "Instagram is an envy amplifier," in response to a clip of Berkshire Hathaway's Vice Chairman Charlie Munger talking about envy. "The world is not driven by greed, it's driven by envy," Munger said. Musk earlier called Instagram a "next-level thirst trap" and revealed that he has a secret account with 54 followers.

107.title: Sushant's Brahmastra enough to destroy B'wood: Late actor's sister on film
107.article_body: After the release of Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's movie 'Brahmastra', later actor Sushant Singh Rajput's sister Meetu Singh said, "Sushant's Brahmastra is enough to destroy Bollywood." "Bollywood has always wanted to dictate the public, never stopping to show mutual respect and humility...Their sorry attempt [at] winning public's love with pretentiousness has failed," she wrote on Instagram.

108.title: Pune road sees noisiest Ganesh immersion festivities since 2013 at 105.2 dB
108.article_body: At 105.2 decibels, Pune's Laxmi Road saw its noisiest Ganesh immersion celebrations since 2013 this year, reports said. Meanwhile, Khanduji Baba Chowk recorded 128 decibels at 8 am on Saturday. "This year, Puneites and Ganesh festival enthusiasts from different places were eager to participate," an official said.

109.title: Truly bringing magic of cinemas alive: Varun Dhawan on 'Brahmāstra'
109.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan on Saturday took to Instagram Stories to appreciate Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmāstra'. The actor wrote, "Congratulations team Brahmastra. Experience this only in the theatre. Truly bringing the magic of cinemas alive on the big screen." Varun further wrote, "The [background music] the performances the vfx everything." The film is directed by Ayan Mukerji.

110.title: SpaceX launches 34 Starlink satellites in its 41st mission of 2022
110.article_body: SpaceX has successfully launched 34 Starlink satellites and AST SpaceMobile's BlueWalker 3 satellite atop a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket completing its 41st mission of 2022. The Falcon 9's first stage landed on the 'A Shortfall of Gravitas' droneship, completing SpaceX's first 14th flight of a first stage booster. SpaceX plans to launch 100 orbital missions in 2023.

111.title: The hard work, passion was magical to witness: Janhvi on 'Brahmāstra'
111.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor on Saturday praised Ayan Mukerji directorial 'Brahmāstra' on Instagram Stories, writing, "The sense of pride I felt while watching this vision come to life was truly overwhelming." She further wrote, "The hard work and passion and vision was magical to witness. Congratulations on creating something we can all feel proud to call a work of Indian cinema."

112.title: Babar is in good form, he has just been unlucky in recent games: Coach Saqlain
112.article_body: Talking about their captain Babar Azam's form in the Asia Cup 2022, Pakistan head coach Saqlain Mushtaq said the 27-year-old has just been unlucky in the tournament so far. "Babar is in good form. It's just that his luck is not going his way," stated Mushtaq. Babar has scored 10, 9, 14, 0 and 30 so far in Asia Cup.

113.title: Traffic restrictions in Bengaluru today for BJP's 'Janotsava' rally
113.article_body: The Bengaluru Police issued traffic diversions and restrictions in the city for today in view of BJP's 'Janotsava' rally to mark Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai's one year in office. In its advisory, the Bengaluru Police asked commuters moving to and from Bengaluru-Ballari road (Kempegowda International Airport road), Devanahalli road and Doddaballapura road to use alternate routes.

114.title: Essay on Udham Singh in Punjab school textbook fallacious, misleading: Historian
114.article_body: Gadri Shaheed Udham Singh Vichar Manch led by historian Rakesh Kumar has written letters to Punjab Chief Minister, Education Minister and Punjab School Education Board (PSEB) Chairman calling the chapter in class 5 textbooks titled 'Shaheed Udham' fallacious and misleading. "These facts are far from historical facts...Even the photo published in the essay does not resemble him," the letter stated.

115.title: Man brings desktop to Bengaluru coffee shop as 'office gets flooded'; pic viral
115.article_body: A picture of a man working from a Bengaluru coffee shop, where he had set up his desktop on a table, has gone viral on social media. "I just saw a group working from the Third Wave Coffee with "a full-fledged desktop setup" because their offices are flooded," a Twitter user said while sharing the picture.

116.title: In many ways, Apple is still run the way Steve Jobs set it up: CEO Tim Cook
116.article_body: Apple CEO Tim Cook at a recent conference said that in many ways, the company is still run the way its late Co-founder Steve Jobs set it up. Cook said he still holds Jobs' traditional 9am Monday meetings for top executives. "We don't sit around and say: 'What would Steve do?'...But...he was the best teacher I ever had," Cook added.

117.title: 23-yr-old Delhi food delivery executive dies as class 11 boy hits bike with SUV
117.article_body: A 23-year-old food delivery executive, who was off-duty and was going to meet a friend, was killed after an SUV hit his motorcycle in Delhi, police said. The SUV was driven by a class 11 student. An FIR was registered in case and the juvenile has been apprehended. The juvenile reportedly told police that he lost control of the vehicle.

118.title: 5-hour rail block on Mumbai's Central, Harbour lines today
118.article_body: Mumbai local train services will be affected on Central and Harbour lines today (September 11) as Central Railway (CR) for Mumbai division will operate a mega block for carrying out maintenance work of rail tracks. There will be a five-hour block from 11:05 am to 4:05 pm between Matunga and Mulund and between Panvel and Vashi stations.

119.title: India observes state mourning today in tribute to Queen Elizabeth
119.article_body: India is observing one day of state mourning on Sunday as a mark of respect to Britain's Queen Elizabeth II. The Queen passed away on September 8. The national flag will be flown at half-mast throughout India on all buildings where the national flag is flown regularly and there will be no official entertainment today, the government said.

120.title: Hyd man dies after falling off lorry, coming under its rear wheels
120.article_body: A 20-year-old man was crushed to death after he fell off a lorry accidentally and then came under its rear wheels in Hyderabad's Abids. The incident took place on Friday when the deceased was returning home after immersion of Ganesh idol in Hussain Sagar. The deceased's body has been taken to the Osmania General Hospital for an autopsy.

121.title: William, Kate, Harry, Meghan appear together for 1st time after Queen's death, pics viral
121.article_body: Prince William and Prince Harry and their respective wives, Kate Middleton and Meghan Markle, appeared together in public for the first time since Queen Elizabeth II's death. They appeared outside Windsor Castle and viewed the floral tributes. They also shook hands and chatted with several people. As per reports, Prince William invited his brother Harry and Megan to join them.

122.title: World number one Iga Świątek becomes first-ever woman from Poland to win US Open
122.article_body: World number one Iga Świątek defeated world number five Ons Jabeur in the women's singles final to become the first-ever woman from Poland to win the US Open title. The 21-year-old won the US Open 2022 final with a scoreline of 6-2, 7-6(7-5). Świątek has now won three Grand Slam titles, including French Open 2020 and 2022 titles.

123.title: US records its milestone 1 millionth organ transplant
123.article_body: The US recorded its one millionth organ transplant on Friday. The achievement was confirmed at 12:50 pm ET by United Network for Organ Sharing, a nonprofit that runs the only organ procurement and transplantation network in US. The first successful organ transplant occurred in 1954 in Boston when doctors transplanted kidney from 23-year-old Ronald Herrick into his twin brother Richard.

124.title: Alcaraz has beaten me a couple of times and I will seek my revenge: Ruud on US Open final
124.article_body: Ahead of his US Open 2022 men's singles final against Carlos Alcaraz, Casper Ruud said, "I hope it will be a good match. He has beaten me a couple of times and I will seek my revenge." He added, "I think if I want to beat Carlos, I'll need to play very precise with all the shots that I hit."

125.title: 2-time Olympic javelin champion and world record holder Barbora Spotakova retires
125.article_body: Two-time Olympic javelin champion and world record holder Barbora Spotakova has announced her retirement. Spotakova, who won Olympic gold in 2008 and 2012 and bronze in 2016, last competed at Diamond League in Zurich on Thursday. She's also the first woman to win three Olympic medals in javelin. Spotakova set the women's javelin world record of 72.28 metres in 2008.

126.title: Body of medical student killed in Armenia reaches India after 14 days
126.article_body: The body of Indian-origin medical student Ashutosh Dwivedi reached his hometown Madhya Pradesh's Rewa on Saturday, 14 days after his demise. The 27-year-old was allegedly killed in Armenia on the intervening night of August 27 and 28. "We're grateful to Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan for helping us bring the body. We're also grateful to...the Indian Embassy," Dwivedi's cousin said.

127.title: 2 coaches of Humsafar Express train derail in Bihar; no one injured
127.article_body: Two coaches of the Katihar-bound Humsafar Express coming from Delhi got derailed in Bihar's West Champaran district on Saturday at around 3 pm, an East Central Railway official said. The train was moving at a slow speed when the coaches jumped the tracks, the official added. He further informed that no one was injured in the incident.

128.title: Fevicol should make him brand ambassador: Prashant Kishor on Nitish
128.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor on Saturday joked that Fevicol should make Bihar CM Nitish Kumar its brand ambassador. He was referring to the fact that Kumar has held onto the CM's post since 2015 and before that from 2005-2014. "We've seen many alliances being made and broken in Bihar...Only [the link] between CM chair and...Kumar [doesn't break]," Kishor said.

129.title: US announces $40 million farming aid to Sri Lanka
129.article_body: The US on Saturday announced $40 million aid to Sri Lanka to help the country procure key agricultural inputs ahead of the next cultivation season. USAID Administrator Samantha Power is presently visiting the country, which is facing an unprecedented economic crisis. She said the aid will be in addition to the already-announced $6 million to assist low income farmers.

130.title: Gujarat CM launches state's 'Cinematic Tourism Policy 2022'
130.article_body: Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel on Saturday launched the state's 'Cinematic Tourism Policy 2022' which aims to attract investment, develop infrastructure, raise entrepreneurial opportunity and increase jobs in the film industry. As per policy, the government will give incentives for making films, documentaries and TV series. The government will also give 100% reimbursement of registration fee.

131.title: Russia to pullback troops from areas in Ukraine’s Kharkiv
131.article_body: Russia's Defense Ministry on Saturday announced it will pull back troops from areas in east Ukraine's Kharkiv region, where a Kyiv-based counteroffensive has made significant progress. Earlier, Ukrainian officials claimed their troops had cut off vital supplies of the Russians to the region. Russian Defense Ministry Spokesman Igor Konashenkov said troops would be regrouped in the Donetsk region.

132.title: Risky for me to participate in National Games: Neeraj Chopra
132.article_body: India's Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra said that it will be risky for him to participate in National Games, which will take place from September 27. He said, "I just recovered from a groin injury. There was a plan to go on a vacation...I won't be able to train...I’d like to start focusing on next year."

133.title: Virat Kohli is tremendous, I think he is more skilful than me: Sourav Ganguly
133.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said he thinks Virat Kohli is more skilful than him. He further said Kohli is tremendous. Ganguly added, "We played in different generations...and we played a lot of cricket. I played in my generation...and he'll continue playing, probably playing more games than I did. Currently...I've played more than what he has but he'll get past that."

134.title: Video shows heaps of cash during raid at Kolkata businessman's house, ₹17cr seized
134.article_body: Videos and pictures on Saturday showed heaps of cash found during a raid by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) at Kolkata-based businessman Nisar Ahmed Khan's house. RBI and SBI officials brought at least eight cash counting machines to Khan's residence and at least ₹17 crores in cash were seized over several hours. The raid was conducted over mobile gaming application fraud.

135.title: As population ages, hip fractures will double worldwide by 2050: Study
135.article_body: Osteoporotic or hip fracture, which generally affects elderly people globally, might double by 2050 as the population ages, a study stated. Researchers gathered information from 19 nations for patients aged 50 and above who suffered hip fractures between 2005 and 2018 and found that in 18 of these countries, an overall rise in hip fracture cases was anticipated over time.

136.title: Don't cross lines: Mahua on BJP criticising Rahul's ₹41,000 t-shirt
136.article_body: Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra said the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) was 'crossing the lines' by commenting on the Opposition members' personal belongings. The BJP had earlier attacked Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, saying he was wearing a ₹41,257 t-shirt while speaking on inflation. "Remember if we start doing the same...you'll rue the day you started this game," Moitra said.

137.title: 6 undertrial prisoners escape from jail in Meghalaya
137.article_body: Six undertrial prisoners escaped from a jail in Meghalaya's West Jaintia Hills district on Saturday at around 2 am, Inspector General of Prisons Jerry FK Marak said. The escapees attacked and overpowered the prison guards, the top official added. A murder accused is among those who broke out of the prison, news agency PTI reported.

138.title: A month after opening, Taliban close girls schools in Afghanistan
138.article_body: Taliban authorities on Saturday closed girls schools (above sixth grade) in Afghanistan’s Paktia province, the Associated Press news agency reported quoting witnesses. Earlier this month, four girls schools in the province's capital, Gardez, and one in Samkani district began operating without permission from the Taliban Education Ministry. All these newly opened schools were closed on Saturday.

139.title: A huge project that has got all larger-than-life elements: Disha on Suriya 42
139.article_body: Actress Disha Patani, speaking about her upcoming film with Suriya, said that it is a "huge project that has got all the larger-than-life elements for the audience to experience on the big screen". She added that she's excited to bring her "never seen before avatar" to the audience. Tentatively titled 'Suriya 42', the film will be directed by Siva.

140.title: Big Foe you didn't let anyone down: Blake after Tiafoe's US Open semis loss
140.article_body: After American Frances Tiafoe lost in his first-ever Grand Slam semi-final at US Open 2022, James Blake tweeted, "Big Foe...you didn't let anyone down. In fact, just the opposite. You lifted so many with your play and your heart. Many more chances." Chris Evert took to Twitter and wrote, "You made us Proud...and you'll win the US Open one day."

141.title: Andhra Pradesh govt to revive Marriage Financial Assistance scheme
141.article_body: The government of Andhra Pradesh has decided to revive the Marriage Financial Assistance scheme for backward classes, minorities, and the differently-abled in the state. The scheme will be launched with a new name and an enhanced scale of benefit, PTI reported. The YS Jagan Mohan Reddy-led government in 2019 had stopped the scheme implemented by former CM Chandrababu Naidu's government.

142.title: Ranveer Singh breaks down while accepting Filmfare award, shares video
142.article_body: Ranveer Singh took to Instagram to share a video of himself receiving Best Actor award at the 67th Filmfare Awards. In the video, he can be seen breaking down while giving the acceptance speech. "Most of the time...I can't even believe that I am here...doing this...I am in disbelieve everyday that I became an actor. It's a miracle," he said.

143.title: Great to play against you and with you as well at RCB: Kohli on Finch's ODI retirement
143.article_body: After Australia white-ball captain Aaron Finch announced his retirement from ODI cricket, Virat Kohli commented on the player's retirement post, writing, "Well done Finchy." He added, "It was great to play against you all these years and with you as well at rcb. Enjoy the next phase of your life to the fullest."

144.title: Aaron Finch shares pics after his ODI retirement, says 'It's been one hell of a ride'
144.article_body: After announcing his ODI retirement, Australia's Aaron Finch took to Instagram to share pictures and pen a note. He wrote, "It's been one hell of a ride...To play with and against some of the greatest players of all time has been a privilege." He added, "Representing Australia was my dream as a kid...Thanks so much for all of the...well wishes!"

145.title: Don't harass persons summoned for enquiry: HC to Tamil Nadu Police
145.article_body: The Madras High Court on Thursday directed the Tamil Nadu Police to not harass persons summoned for enquiry at police stations. Police should summon a witness or an accused in any case through a written summon, it added. The court observed that power to enquire must be exercised within the framework of Chapter XII of the Code of Criminal Procedure.

146.title: Queen's funeral to be held on Monday, she'll Lie-in-State for 4 days: Royal Family
146.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II's funeral will be held on September 19 (Monday) at London's Westminster Abbey, Britain's Royal Family announced on Saturday. It'll be held at 1100 hours BST (3.30 pm IST). "Prior to the State Funeral, The Queen will Lie-in-State in Westminster Hall for four days, to allow the public to pay their respects," said the Royals in a statement.

147.title: Overwhelmed by the amazing response to my 'Brahmastra' character: Mouni
147.article_body: Actress Mouni Roy, speaking about her latest movie 'Brahmastra', said that she's "truly overwhelmed" by the "amazing response" the film and her character has been receiving. "I had dedicated myself thoroughly for my role Junoon and I am glad the patience has paid off," she added. The Ayan Mukerji directorial reportedly collected ₹35-36 crore in India on the first day.

148.title: Congrats to this bloke, 17 tons in only 145 ODIs: Maxwell on Finch's ODI retirement
148.article_body: Reacting to the announcement of Australia ODI captain Aaron Finch's retirement from ODI cricket, teammate Glenn Maxwell wrote on Instagram, "Congrats to this bloke on an amazing ODI career!!" He added, "17 tons in only 145 games, WC [World Cup] winner, captained for over a third of your career...countless blow ups with me, 1,36,000 bubbles blown while batting. Enjoy retirement."

149.title: Reply to pleas on convicts' remission in Bilkis case: SC to Gujarat
149.article_body: The Supreme Court has asked the Gujarat government to file its response to petitions challenging the remission of sentence granted to 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gang-rape case from the 2002 Gujarat riots. The SC also asked the convicts to file their response. On August 15, the Gujarat government had released the 11 convicts under its remission policy.

150.title: King Charles III proclaimed Canada's new head of state
150.article_body: King Charles III was proclaimed the new monarch of Canada in a formal ceremony in Ottawa on Saturday. The ceremony took place at the official residence of Canada's Governor General. Charles III automatically became the king of the United Kingdom (UK) and 14 other Commonwealth realms, including Canada, upon the death of his mother, Queen Elizabeth II, on Thursday.

151.title: Andhra woman wades through river to appear for exam; video surfaces
151.article_body: A video has surfaced online, showing a 21-year-old student in Andhra Pradesh's Vizianagaram district wading through a river to appear for an examination. As per reports, the river was in spate due to heavy rains upstream, which cut off the village. Her brother and another family member carried her on their shoulders as she reportedly didn't know how to swim.

152.title: Can't afford to make so many changes: RP Singh on India's Asia Cup performance
152.article_body: Commenting on India's performance in Asia Cup 2022, RP Singh said, "You can't afford to make so many changes in...Indian team." He added, "You need to understand that the insecurity among the players increases and it disturbs...balance of the team." Defending champions India couldn't qualify for the final after losing two out of three matches in the Super 4 stage.

153.title: Climate change is affecting drinking water quality: Study
153.article_body: Researchers studied the Rappbode reservoir, Germany's largest drinking water reservoir, and found that climate-related disappearance of forests can affect water quality. As per researchers, forests filter the water and bind nutrients and are, therefore, necessary for good water quality. They also warned that the problem of such indirect consequences of climate change is seriously underestimated.

154.title: 20 died across Maharashtra during Ganesh idol immersions: Police
154.article_body: At least 20 persons died in accidents during the immersion of Ganesh idols across Maharashtra this year, police said on Saturday. In total, 14 people drowned in separate incidents in Wardha, Yavatmal, Ahmednagar, Jalgaon, Pune, Satara and Solapur districts. The 10-day Ganesh Chaturthi festival started on August 31 and ended on Friday.

155.title: Sharad Pawar unanimously re-elected as NCP President for 4 years
155.article_body: Sharad Pawar has been unanimously re-elected as the President of the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP), party spokesperson Mahesh Bharat Tapase said on Saturday. The 81-year-old leader will be NCP President for another four years. The decision was announced at the party's national executive meeting, which was attended by MLA Ajit Pawar, MP Praful Patel, MP Supriya Sule and others.

156.title: Newly-engaged couple on way to see Taj Mahal dies in road accident
156.article_body: A newly-engaged couple was killed in a road accident on Yamuna Expressway while travelling to visit the Taj Mahal, police said on Saturday. The car in which the couple was travelling, hit another vehicle from behind, police added. According to police, the couple succumbed at the spot. The accident occurred at around Friday midnight, Additional SP (Rural) Mathura said.

157.title: We're now just one step away from our goal of winning Asia Cup trophy: Babar
157.article_body: Ahead of Sri Lanka-Pakistan final in Asia Cup 2022, Pakistan captain Babar Azam said his side has seen some great performances and different players have shone in the tournament. "We're now just one step away from our goal of winning the trophy...As a team, our goal is to perform well," he added. Final will be played in Dubai on Sunday.

158.title: India should be united, not divided to move ahead: Anurag Thakur
158.article_body: Union minister Anurag Thakur on Saturday said India should be united and not divided to move ahead. Speaking at a programme on Himachal Pradesh's formation day, Thakur said, "We're celebrating 75 years of Independence as 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav'." "Our PM has shown the right direction for India [for] the next 25 years...this Independence Day," he added.

159.title: The problem in India is that everyone wants a gold medal: Neeraj Chopra
159.article_body: Reacting to some people saying he should have won gold medal instead of silver at World Championships, Indian javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra said, "This is the problem in India. That everyone wants a gold medal." He added, "It's very important to know that in this sport, it isn't possible to get a gold medal [every time]."

160.title: He's the only actor to succeed in all genres: Sunny on father Dharmendra
160.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol said in an interview that his father, veteran actor Dharmendra Deol, is "the only actor to succeed in all genres". He added his father never shied away from exploring different roles. "Be it Satyakam, Chupke Chupke, Sholay, Pratigya, Phool Aur Patthar...he has done it all. I wish I was an active actor in his era," said Sunny.

161.title: Cost to rebuild war-hit Ukraine reaches $349 billion: Report
161.article_body: The cost to rebuild Ukraine and its economy after the Russian war has reached $349 billion, stated a report by the European Commission, the World Bank and the Ukrainian government. It presents estimates up to June 1, not accounting for the damage thereafter. Direct damage is estimated at $97 billion and disruption to economic flows is estimated at $252 billion.

162.title: Child steals ₹10 lakh from UP bank within 7 seconds; video emerges
162.article_body: A child stole ₹10 lakh in broad daylight from the cash counter of a district cooperative bank within seven seconds in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura on Thursday. A CCTV footage showed the minor boy putting two bundles of cash into his bag while the cashier was not present at the counter. Police are currently looking for the boy.

163.title: BJP opposes dynasty politics democratically: Assam CM Himanta Sarma
163.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Saturday criticised dynasty politics and said the country should be free of such politics. "This is the issue in Uttar Pradesh, Bihar and also Telangana, where dynasty politics is going on," Sarma said. "BJP opposes that democratically. A democratic party should replace 'family raj'," Sarma added.

164.title: 330 kg of stolen railway scrap seized in WB's Baruipur, 4 arrested
164.article_body: Police on Saturday arrested four persons and seized 330 kg of railway scrap being stolen by them from Beniadanga Railway workshop in West Bengal's Baruipur, an official said. A police team led by Sub-Inspector Sukumar Rabidas during patrol duty in the early hours of Saturday intercepted the four persons, the official said, adding that a case has been registered.

165.title: Neha meets old friend during Indian Idol 13 auditions, refuses to judge him
165.article_body: A promo for the singing reality show 'Indian Idol 13' showed singer-judge Neha Kakkar meeting her old friend Vineet Singh during the audition round. She, however, refused to judge him. "Vineet had gone on a show where he emerged as the star. So I can't judge [him]," she said. Vineet eventually convinced Neha to judge him.

166.title: Maha man stopped from shooting video at police post bites policeman
166.article_body: An offence has been registered against a man for allegedly biting a policeman who stopped him from shooting a video of on-duty personnel at a police post in Maharashtra's Nagpur, an officer said on Saturday. The 30-year-old accused had argued with police officers for not registering a case against a man with whom he had a dispute, the officer added.

167.title: 17 Chinese aircraft crossed Taiwan Strait median line, says Taipei
167.article_body: As many as 17 Chinese aircraft crossed the median line of the Taiwan Strait on Saturday, as per Taiwan's Defence Ministry. China has stepped up military activity around Taiwan since US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taipei visit last month. Earlier this month, in a first-of-its-kind incident, Taiwanese military shot down a Chinese drone in Taiwan's airspace.

168.title: BBC auto-captions mishear 'Regina' as 'vagina' during news report on Queen's death
168.article_body: During the news coverage of the events linked to Queen Elizabeth II's demise, BBC News auto-subtitles misheard the anchor and flashed the word "vagina" instead of "Regina". A viewer shared a picture of the mistake on Twitter, saying, "Oops.. BBC should really be more careful with their auto subtitles." BBC was explaining how King Charles' wife Camilla wasn't 'Queen Regina'.

169.title: 2 dead, 2 missing after snake boat capsizes in river in Kerala
169.article_body: Two persons died and two others went missing on Saturday after a palliyodam (snake boat) capsized in the Achankovil river in Kerala's Chennithala, police said. The incident took place when the victims were preparing to participate in the Aranmula Boat Race on Sunday. A senior police officer said that there were around 60 people on the boat.

170.title: Centre refused to share funds for farmers to stop stubble burning: Punjab CM
170.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Saturday said the Centre has turned down the proposal of the AAP-led governments in Punjab and Delhi to give cash incentives to farmers for not burning stubble during the upcoming kharif harvest. "It does not matter. If the central government is not supporting, then it does not mean we will not do anything," Mann added.

171.title: King Charles places gift from William & Harry on desk as he's officially declared monarch
171.article_body: King Charles signed the declaration which officially made him the new British monarch using ink from a pot gifted to him by his sons, Prince William and Prince Harry. He was declared monarch at a meeting of the Accession Council. During the meeting, which was televised for the first time in history, King Charles signed two copies of the declaration.

172.title: Afridi reveals his daughter waved Indian flag at Asia Cup match due to lack of Pak flags
172.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi revealed his daughter waved Indian flag during the Asia Cup 2022 match between the teams due to lack of Pakistani flags at the Dubai stadium. "My wife told me the crowd comprised just 10% Pakistanis and 90% Indians," he added. "I received the video...I was unsure about whether to share it online or not," Afridi said.

173.title: This is one of the best Asia Cups we've had: SL skipper Shanaka ahead of final
173.article_body: Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said his side is looking forward to playing in Asia Cup 2022 final against a "very good" Pakistan team. "As a tournament, looking back, this has been one of the best Asia Cups we have had," he added. Sri Lanka won all three matches in the Super 4 stage. Final will be played on Sunday.

174.title: Selectors might tilt towards favouring Kohli for opening spot: Reetinder
