174.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Reetinder Sodhi said Virat Kohli's maiden T20I century against Afghanistan in Asia Cup 2022 might tilt the selectors and team management towards favouring the India batter for the opening position alongside Rohit Sharma. "He [Kohli] also has the ability to hit good balls for boundaries," he added. Kohli, who opened alongside KL Rahul against Afghanistan, scored 122*(61).

175.title: I don't even know who she is: Pakistan's Naseem Shah on Urvashi over viral video
175.article_body: After an edited video of him and actress Urvashi Rautela from Asia Cup 2022 went viral on social media, Pakistan's 19-year-old fast bowler Naseem Shah said, "I don't even know who Urvashi is." He added, "I have no idea why do people make and share such videos." He further said that he has no plans of entering into showbiz.

176.title: Bihar policemen allegedly kept inside lockup by senior: Report
176.article_body: Five policemen were reportedly kept inside a lockup for two hours over the alleged orders of Superintendent of Police Gaurav Mangala in Bihar's Nawada. The SP was reportedly dissatisfied with the performance of the three assistant sub-inspectors and two sub-inspectors. The Bihar Police Association has sought a judicial probe into the matter.

177.title: I enjoy anchoring with my husband, there's no competition: Bharti
177.article_body: Bharti Singh said in an interview that many people have issues with her anchoring. "[They]...feel that I try to steal somebody else's thunder by cracking such jokes that the focus and attention stay on me," she added. Bharti further said this is also the reason she enjoys anchoring with her husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa because there's "no competition or any awkwardness".

178.title: Iran hurting chances of nuclear deal revival: France, Germany & UK
178.article_body: France, Germany, and the UK on Saturday criticised Iran for demanding the closure of an ongoing probe by the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) as a guarantee for a "sustainable" revival of the 2015 nuclear deal. "This latest demand raises serious doubts as to Iran's intentions and commitment" and "jeopardises" prospects of restoring the deal, the three countries said.

179.title: Archaeologist BB Lal passes away at the age of 101; PM pays tribute
179.article_body: Archaeologist and Padma Vibhushan awardee Braj Basi Lal died at the age of 101 on Saturday. Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid tribute to Lal and said, "His contributions to culture and archaeology are unparalleled." Lal, former Director General of Archaeological Survey of India, had reportedly found temple-like pillars at the Ayodhya site where the Ram temple is now being built.

180.title: SP losing support base in UP, its own action is the reason: Mayawati
180.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati on Saturday criticised Samajwadi Party saying it is losing its support base in Uttar Pradesh and its own action is the main reason. "When there's news in the media about their mutual quarrels and tussles within the family, party...and about their open nexus with criminal elements...then why should there be no disappointment among the people," Mayawati tweeted.

181.title: Won't give up right to self-defence: Kim Jong-un on denuclearisation
181.article_body: North Korea's Supreme Leader Kim Jong-un on Thursday said that the US wants to weaken his country's "rights to self-defence" through its denuclearisation, North Korean state media reported. "We will never give up our rights...to temporarily ease the difficulties we are experiencing now," Kim added. North Korea recently passed a law allowing it to launch a pre-emptive nuclear strike.

182.title: Haasan's 'Vikram' completes 100 days in theatres, actor shares post
182.article_body: Kamal Haasan took to Twitter on Saturday to share a post marking 100 days since the release of 'Vikram'. In an audio message, Haasan said, "With...support accorded by fans, 'Vikram' has now touched the 100-day mark in theatres...In my heart, I hug...every one of you who've been admiring me beyond generations." The film also starred Fahadh Faasil and Vijay Sethupathi.

183.title: 27-yr-old Naxalite carrying ₹10 lakh reward surrenders in Chhattisgarh
183.article_body: A 27-year-old Naxalite, Lallu Modiyan, carrying a reward of ₹10 lakh surrendered before the police in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district on Saturday, an official said. Modiyan was a member of the Jharkhand Regional Committee. Modiyan had joined the Naxal movement in June 2009 and was tasked with sending messages and keeping a watch on the police, the official said.

184.title: Fraudsters cheat Serum Institute of ₹1 crore by asking for money transfer in CEO's name
184.article_body: Fraudsters cheated vaccine-maker Serum Institute of India (SII) of over ₹1 crore by sending messages on WhatsApp in the name of its CEO Adar Poonawalla and asking for transfer of money, Pune Police said. Believing that the messages were sent by Adar, company officials transferred the amount and later realised that he had not sent any such WhatsApp communication.

185.title: Boy tied to tree & beaten by priest for stealing almonds in MP, FIR filed
185.article_body: An 11-year-old boy was allegedly tied to a tree and beaten up by a priest at a Jain temple in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar district for stealing almonds offered to God, police said on Saturday. A case has been registered based on a complaint lodged by the boy's father. In a video, he is purportedly seen crying and asking for help.

186.title: PM Modi calls UK PM Liz Truss to express condolences over Queen's demise
186.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday spoke with the new British PM Liz Truss on phone, to congratulate her on assuming the country's top office and to condole Queen Elizabeth II's demise, the government said. "On behalf of the people of India, PM Modi conveyed deep condolences to the Royal family and the people of the UK," said a government release.

187.title: American player Tiafoe breaks down on live TV after losing US Open semi, video viral
187.article_body: American tennis player Frances Tiafoe broke down on live TV after losing the US Open 2022 men's singles semi-final against Spain's Carlos Alcaraz. Tiafoe broke down while being interviewed on court after his loss. "This one really really hurts," he said. "I'm going to come back and I will win this thing one day. I am sorry, guys," he added.

188.title: Bopanna pulls out of India's Davis Cup tie vs Norway due to injury
188.article_body: Doubles tennis player Rohan Bopanna has withdrawn from India's Davis Cup 2022 World Group I tie against Norway due to knee inflammation. The tie will be held on September 16 and 17 in Lillehammer, Norway. "I have an inflammation on my knee and have been advised to rest it before I start competing again," tweeted Bopanna.

189.title: Theatres open early morning, late night shows of 'Brahmāstra' amid huge demand
189.article_body: With many shows of 'Brahmāstra' going houseful, theatres in many major centres have opened early morning and late night shows to keep up with increased demand. On Saturday, some people tweeted screenshots of theatres in Delhi opening shows as early as 6 am for IMAX version. New shows mean the film will run in some screens for almost 21 hours.

190.title: Argentine TV anchor celebrates Queen's death by drinking champagne, criticised
190.article_body: An Argentinian TV presenter was criticised for celebrating Queen Elizabeth II's death by drinking champagne live on air. A video of the broadcast showed Santiago Cúneo pouring himself a drink while the message "The old bag of s*** has died" flashed on the screen. "I'm Argentinian...this guy doesn't represent me," said a Twitter user, while another called him a "disgrace".

191.title: Australia's Warner, Stoinis ruled out of 3rd ODI against New Zealand
191.article_body: Australia all-rounder Marcus Stoinis has been ruled out of the team's third and final ODI against New Zealand due to a side strain, while opener David Warner was released from the squad to rest. There is no injury concern for Warner. The third ODI will be played on Sunday. Australia lead the three-match ODI series 2-0.

192.title: House collapses into river after cloudburst in U'khand; video surfaces
192.article_body: A woman died and nearly 50 houses were left submerged in Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh after a cloudburst was reported near the Dharchula town, officials said. In a video shared by Uttarakhand Police's Fire Service, a house is seen collapsing into the Kali river. Pithoragarh DM Ashish Kumar Chauhan said 170 affected people of Khotila village have been evacuated.

193.title: 40% of electric vehicles in Delhi bought after 2020 policy: Govt
193.article_body: The sale of electric vehicles (EVs) in Delhi increased after the implementation of the 2020 Electric Vehicles Policy, with 40% of all vehicles being bought after the policy came into effect. According to official data till August 31 this year, Delhi has over 1.64 lakh electric vehicles. Of these, 67,063 vehicles were purchased after the policy's implementation.

194.title: 19-yr-old Hyd woman killed by man for rejecting his marriage proposal
194.article_body: A 19-year-old woman from Hyderabad was allegedly killed by a man for rejecting his marriage proposal in Telangana's Wanaparthy. On August 5, the accused asked the woman to visit his village. When she reached there, he asked her to marry him, but she refused, leading to an argument between them. Following this, he reportedly strangled her with her dupatta.

195.title: Haryana Police arrest man for committing ATM fraud in 3 states
195.article_body: The Haryana Police on Saturday said they arrested a man, Rohit alias Amit, who was allegedly involved in ATM fraud cases in Haryana, Himachal Pradesh and Rajasthan. Amit used to fraudulently obtain automated teller machine (ATM) cards from unknown people and clone them. Later, on the pretext of helping them, he used to get passwords and siphon money, police said.

196.title: 'Dhokha: Round D Corner' was completed in just 29 days: Director Kookie
196.article_body: Director Kookie Gulati revealed that he completed the shoot of his upcoming film, 'Dhokha: Round D Corner', in 29 days. "We kept a target to finish...in 44 days but with...proficiency of R Madhavan, Khushali (Kumar), Darshan (Kumaar) and Aparshakti (Khurana), we were able to complete [it] in just 29 days," he said. The film will be released on September 23.

197.title: My mind is blown, Rajamouli is a genius: Jennifer Beals on RRR
197.article_body: American actress Jennifer Beals, known for films like 'Flashdance' and 'The Book of Eli', on Friday tweeted, "I just watched the epic RRR in a theatre and my mind is BLOWN." Calling the film's director SS Rajamouli a "genius", she added, "Leaving the theatre, I wanted to work out, dance and meditate-all at once. Long live the revolutionaries!"

198.title: Shah lays foundation stone of border tourism development work in Rajasthan
198.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday laid the foundation stone of border tourism development work at India-Pakistan border in Rajasthan, around 120 kilometres from Jaisalmer. He laid the foundation stone of the project as part of his two-day visit to Rajasthan. "For the first time...development is reaching the border areas under the leadership of (PM) Modi ji," Shah said.

199.title: Rahul Gandhi needs to study history first: Amit Shah on 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
199.article_body: Taking a swipe at Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Union Home Minister Amit Shah said Rahul Gandhi needs to study the country's history first. "[In] his speech given in Parliament, Rahul...said India is not a nation at all...in which book have you read this?" Shah said. "This is the nation for which lakhs...of people have sacrificed their lives," he added.

200.title: No metro services between Qutab Minar, Sultanpur on Sunday morning
200.article_body: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has announced that train services will not be available from Sultanpur to Qutab Minar on the Yellow Line for going towards Samaypur Badli from 5:15 am to 6:00 am on Sunday. The services are being suspended due to maintenance work. However, trains will be available from Qutab Minar for going towards Samaypur Badli.

201.title: Home registration in Hyd region see 36% yr-on-yr decline in Aug: Report
201.article_body: Registration of residential properties in the Hyderabad region fell 36% year-on-year (YoY) to 5,181 units in August 2022, as per Knight Frank India. In August 2021, 8,144 housing units were registered in the Hyderabad residential market that includes four districts — Hyderabad, Medchal-Malkajgiri, Rangareddy and Sangareddy. The value of properties transacted in August 2022 was ₹2,657.8 crore.

202.title: Virat Kohli shares childhood pic, says 'Eat, drink and enjoy'
202.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli took to his Instagram Stories to share a childhood picture of himself, wherein he can be seen eating. "Khao piyo aish karo mitro...Dil par kise da dukhayo na (Eat, drink and enjoy, friends...but don't hurt anyone's feelings)," he wrote in the caption, using lyrics from the 2001 Punjabi song 'Aish Karo'.

203.title: Indian Sikh brother reunites with Pakistani Muslim sister 75 years after Partition
203.article_body: Jalandhar-based Sikh man Amarjit Singh met his Muslim sister Kulsoom Akhtar from Pakistan at Gurdwara Darbar Sahib in Kartarpur, 75 years after he was separated from his family at the time of Partition. Talking to Pakistan's Express Tribune, Kulsoom said her parents migrated to Pakistan from a suburb in Jalandhar in 1947, leaving behind her brother and a sister.

204.title: Pools in Hockey WC are always difficult: Indian men's team head coach Reid
204.article_body: After India were drawn in Pool D with England, Spain and Wales in Hockey World Cup 2023, Indian men's hockey team head coach Graham Reid said World Cup and Olympics pools are always difficult. "Every team is there to win. We just played England and Wales in...Birmingham 2022 Commonwealth Games and the games were of the highest quality," he added.

205.title: 173 lumpy skin disease cases reported in Delhi: Minister Gopal Rai
205.article_body: Delhi has so far recorded 173 cases of lumpy skin disease with most cases reported in the city's south and west, Minister for Environment Gopal Rai said. Most cases have been reported from the Goyla Dairy area (45 cows) and Rewla Khanpur (40 cows). The symptoms include nodules on the cow's skin, fever, watery eyes and weight loss.

206.title: Nearly half of the dengue cases in 2022 were reported in Aug: PMC
206.article_body: Nearly half of the suspected dengue fever cases reported this year under the Pune Municipal Corporation's (PMC) limits were recorded in August. According to the PMC's data, 2,621 suspected cases of dengue were reported till September 3. "At least 1,062 suspected cases of dengue viral fever were detected in August itself," said Assistant Health Chief, PMC, Dr Sanjeev Wavare.

207.title: Last of Moosewala's 6 shooters, his 2 aides arrested near Bengal-Nepal border
207.article_body: Punjab Police said the last of the six shooters involved in the murder of singer Sidhu Moosewala, Deepak Mundi, was arrested on Saturday from near the West Bengal-Nepal border, along with two of his associates. "Deepak was the shooter in Bolero module, [while] Kapil Pandit and Rajinder provided logistical support, including weapons and hideouts," Punjab DGP Gaurav Yadav said.

208.title: US sanctions Iran's Intelligence Ministry over cyberattack on Albania
208.article_body: The US Treasury Department on Friday imposed new sanctions on Iran's Ministry of Intelligence for its alleged involvement in a cyberattack against NATO member and US ally Albania in July. The move came after Albania severed diplomatic ties with Iran and ordered the expulsion of Iranian diplomats and embassy staff on Wednesday over the incident.

209.title: 96 samples of sweet, snacks, ghee & edible oil collected in Mumbai
209.article_body: As part of a drive initiated before the beginning of Ganeshotsav, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) in Mumbai collected 96 samples of sweets, snacks, ghee and edible oil sold in markets. As many as 51 samples of sweets, six samples of snacks and seven samples of edible oil were sent for quality check purposes, an FDA official informed.

210.title: His real face is anti-Hindu: Sambit Patra on Rahul Gandhi's video with pastor
210.article_body: Reacting to a video of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi with Tamil pastor George Ponnaiah, BJP leader Sambit Patra said it's not the first time Rahul has made indecent remarks against Hinduism. He said Rahul visits temples during elections to create a farce. "When elections conclude, this farce of Rahul...ends and his real...anti-Hindu face...comes to light," he added.

211.title: No music allowed in dressing room for India Women's T20I as England mourns Queen's death
211.article_body: Players will not be allowed to play music in the dressing room during India Women-England Women's first T20I at the Riverside Ground in Chester-le-Street. This comes as England is mourning the demise of Queen Elizabeth II. Further, there will be no commercial activity allowed inside the stadium, reports said. The country's flags at the venue will also be at half-mast.

212.title: Police seize 860 kg marijuana from Assam's Karbi Anglong, 3 held
212.article_body: The Assam Police and Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) seized 860 kg of marijuana and 40.70 grams of suspected heroin from a truck in Karbi Anglong district on Saturday. Three persons have been arrested in the case. The truck was coming from Manipur and the drugs were hidden inside a secret chamber of the truck's body, a police official said.

213.title: What does 'EIIR', seen on the throne during King Charles' accession ceremony, mean?
213.article_body: The symbol 'EIIR' was seen on the throne of the British monarch during King Charles III's accession ceremony in St James' Palace on Saturday. It is the late Queen Elizabeth II's royal cypher and stands for Elizabeth II Regina, as 'Regina' means queen in Latin. The cypher is likely to change to 'CIIIR' to represent King Charles, reports said.

214.title: The film student in me needs to watch Brahmastra again: Hrithik
214.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan took to Twitter on Saturday to praise Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmastra', saying, "The film student in me needs to watch Brahmastra again." "The action, the grading, the BGM, the VFX, the sound design uff...Absolutely incredible work!! Too good," he wrote, adding, "Thoroughly enjoyed this one." The film reportedly collected ₹35-36 crore at the domestic box office on Friday.

215.title: Bomb explodes in front of RSS worker's residence in Kerala
215.article_body: A bomb exploded in front of a Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) worker's house in Kannur, Kerala, on Thursday night. According to Mattannur Police, the bomb exploded about 50 metres away from the house of RSS worker Sudheesh. Police have registered a case under the Explosives Act. Notably, police said that Sudheesh is also accused in many cases.

216.title: Pune admin to acquire 6,000-hectare land for Purandar airport
216.article_body: The Pune district administration said it will require 6,000 hectares of land for the Purandar Airport and logistics park. This followed Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's announcement that the airfield will be constructed along with a logistics park. As per the initial proposal, the airport would require 2,832-hectare land. The proposed logistical park will require additional 3,103-hectare land.

217.title: Suriya's next pan-India 3D film to release in 10 languages
217.article_body: Actor Suriya's next film, tentatively titled 'Suriya 42', will be shot in 3D and be released in 10 languages. Disha Patani has been roped in to play the female lead in the upcoming film. It will be directed by Siva. The motion poster of the film was launched on Friday. Suriya was recently seen in Kamal Haasan-starrer 'Vikram'.

218.title: Man shot at in Mumbai's Bandra by unidentified assailant
218.article_body: A man was shot by an unidentified assailant in Mumbai's Bandra East area on Thursday, a police official told PTI on Friday. The bullet fired by the assailant hit the victim on his back, the official added. The official further informed that the victim is undergoing treatment at a hospital. "An attempt to murder case has been registered," he stated.

219.title: 11 suffer electric shock during Ganesh idol immersion in Panvel
219.article_body:
At least 11 persons in Panvel suffered an electric shock after a wire from the generator machine snapped during Ganesh idol immersion. "One is in the ICU, while two of those affected are small children aged five and 15," Panvel Municipal Corporation Commissioner Ganesh Deshmukh said. 
Deshmukh added that the police were yet to determine why the wire snapped.

220.title: Will stand with Ukraine for as long as it is necessary: Germany
220.article_body: Germany's support for Ukraine wouldn't falter in the face of reduced Russian energy supplies, German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock said as she arrived in Kyiv. "We'll stand by Ukraine for as long as necessary," Baerbock said, adding that German support would include arms and financial aid. It's Baerbock's second visit to Kyiv since Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24.

221.title: I'll win this thing: American Tiafoe after losing in US Open semis
221.article_body: Following his loss in the US Open semi-final, US' Frances Tiafoe said, "I gave everything I had these past two weeks...This one really, really hurts." He added, "I'm going to come back and I'll win this [US Open] thing one day." Tiafoe lost to Carlos Alcaraz 7-6(8-6), 3-6, 1-6, 7-6(7-5), 3-6. Both were playing in their maiden Grand Slam semi-final.

222.title: PM Modi proud of his heritage, unlike Nehru: UP CM Yogi Adityanath
222.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Friday said unlike former Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru, PM Narendra Modi is "proud" of the country's heritage. "There was one Prime Minister who didn't feel proud of his heritage, and then there's Narendra Modi, who has resolved to make the whole India, 'Ek Bharat Shreshtha Bharat', by connecting with his heritage," he said.

223.title: 25-yr-old man booked for raping Class 2 student in UP's Ballia
223.article_body: A 25-year-old man has been booked for allegedly raping a Class 2 student in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia. The accused reportedly lured the seven-year-old girl when she was playing outside and took her to his house on a motorcycle, where he raped her, police said. A case was registered after the girl's father filed a police complaint.

224.title: 'The Lion King' prequel announced, film to release in 2024
224.article_body: A prequel to the 2019 film 'The Lion King' was announced on Friday. Titled 'Mufasa: The Lion King', the upcoming film will release in 2024. Oscar-winning director Barry Jenkins, who's set to helm the project, said it is a "story about how Mufasa rose to royalty". The film will also feature the younger versions of characters Timon, Pumbaa and Rafiki.

225.title: Don’t have a plan that requires people to return to office: Amazon CEO
225.article_body: Amazon doesn't have plans to ask its corporate employees to return to office with CEO Andy Jassy saying, "We don't right now. But we're going to proceed adaptively as we learn." During the COVID-19 pandemic, Amazon had announced in October 2021 that it would leave it up to individual managers to decide when workers needed to come to office.

226.title: 'Secularism experts' now decide who's secular, who's communal: Owaisi
226.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Saturday criticised Opposition parties for posing as "experts of secularism". "When we speak of the development of minority communities...nonsense is spoken against us. This is hypocrisy in a way that those posing as experts of secularism today will decide who's secular and who's communal," Owaisi said while addressing a press conference in Ahmedabad.

227.title: Area around Kartavya Path barricaded, visitors find difficult to find parking
227.article_body: Visitors found it difficult to find the four newly developed parking lots along Kartavya Path in Delhi. The area was barricaded, reports said, adding that one of the four parking lots was closed while the police said that parking lots were opened for the public. Security guards at parking located between C-hexagona and Man Singh Road only allowed government vehicles.

228.title: CCTV video shows dog biting food delivery man's private parts in Mumbai
228.article_body: A CCTV video, showing a pet dog biting a Zomato delivery man on his private parts inside a Mumbai building, has been widely shared online. The video was captured by a camera inside an elevator as the delivery person was exiting it on August 29. The man was reportedly hospitalised and the dog's owner paid his medical bills.

229.title: Forming 'khichdi govt' with weaker PM better than 'two-time PM': Owaisi
229.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has said that it will be better to form a "khichdi" government with a weaker PM than a "two-time PM" who complains about the system. "Those posing as experts of secularism today will decide who's secular and who's communal…BJP has 306 MPs, yet the PM complains about the system," Owaisi added.

230.title: ED raids Kolkata premises in fraud gaming app case; ₹7 cr seized so far
230.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Saturday raided several premises in Kolkata in a fraud mobile gaming application case. The ED has seized ₹7 crore as of now. Cash counting machines have been brought by the ED as the counting of cash is ongoing. A man named Amir Khan, who had launched gaming application 'E-Nuggets', has been accused in the case.

231.title: Online gaming firm Roblox plans to launch 3D advertising next year
231.article_body: Online gaming firm Roblox Corporation said on Friday that it is planning to launch 3D advertising on its platform next year, adding that it will test ads with developers and some advertisers by this year-end. Better known as "immersive ads", the 3D advertising experience will be available to audiences aged only 13 and above, the California-based company said.

232.title: Will regularise temporary employees in states where AAP forms govt: Kejriwal
232.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief Arvind Kejriwal said his party will regularise temporary employees wherever it forms government. While lauding the AAP-led Punjab government for regularising 8,736 school teachers, Kejriwal urged all state governments to do the same. He further termed the contractual employment system "exploitative" and said only permanent employees should be there in the government.

233.title: Military base, road in Arunachal's Kibithu named after Bipin Rawat
233.article_body: A military station along the LAC in Arunachal Pradesh's Kibithu and a 22-kilometre-long stretch of road were named after former CDS General Bipin Rawat, who died in a helicopter crash last year. The station was named as Gen Bipin Rawat Military Garrison, while the road as Gen Bipin Rawat Marg. A life-size mural of Rawat was also unveiled, said officials.

234.title: Child-lifting rumours trigger mob attacks in UP, 35 booked in several incidents
234.article_body: Child-lifting rumours reportedly triggered widespread panic in parts of Uttar Pradesh. Reports said that several incidents of mob lynching and killing on suspicion of being a child-lifter increased following such rumours. An official said that so far 35 people were booked over several incidents that took place in the state. The police have said that these rumours are baseless.

235.title: US imposes sanctions on Iran over cyberattack on Albania
235.article_body: The US on Friday imposed sanctions on Iran's Intelligence Ministry and its minister in response to a July cyberattack that disrupted government websites in Albania and for engaging in other cyber activities against the US and its allies. On Wednesday, Albania severed diplomatic relations with Iran for the incident, ordering Iranian diplomats and embassy staff to leave within 24 hours.

236.title: 'Huge gap' in National Education Policy 2020: Manish Sisodia
236.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia expressed disappointment over the National Education Policy (NEP), 2020 and said that it cannot be implemented immediately as there is a "huge gap" in the scheme. "Changes are needed in NEP 2020...It is also the vision of Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal that education-related policies are given a 360-degree view," said Sisodia.

237.title: IIT Hyderabad releases statement after death of 2 students by suicide
237.article_body: IIT Hyderabad released a statement after the death of two of its students by suicide. In a statement, the institute said students feel pressure at the beginning of their projects, however, they're given time to grasp the requirements. On September 7, a former IIT Hyderabad student allegedly died by suicide and on August 31, an MTech student died by suicide.

238.title: 'Dog Officers' are ensuring Ganpati venues are safe: Pune police
238.article_body: The Pune City Police on Friday tweeted, "Our 'Dog Officers' Surya and Rana [are] ensuring all Ganpati venues and adjacent lanes are safe for us 'humans'!" The police also shared pictures of the same and said that the bomb detection and disposal teams are inspecting areas. The police added that all safety precautions are being taken amid the celebrations.

239.title: 1,108 kg ganja worth ₹2 crore seized near Assam-Tripura border, 1 held
239.article_body: Police seized 1,108 kg of ganja worth about ₹2 crore in Karimganj district along the Assam-Tripura border on Friday. One person has been arrested in the case. Police said that the ganja was seized from a truck coming from Tripura towards Guwahati. The ganja was recovered from a secret chamber in the truck.

240.title: Hopeful of at least two more trade deals by year-end: Piyush Goyal
240.article_body: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said that India recently signed two trade agreements with the UAE and Australia. He also hopes to conclude the negotiations for two more such pacts by the year-end. Free trade agreement (FTA) negotiations with the UK are expected to be finalised this month, while talks with Canada for a deal are progressing well.

241.title: Typical BJP mischief: Congress on video of pastor telling Rahul 'Jesus is real God'
241.article_body: Congress has reacted to a video shared by the BJP, showing a pastor telling Rahul Gandhi, "Jesus is the real God." Congress communication in charge Jairam Ramesh called the video "typical BJP mischief", saying that BJP's tweet bore "no relation whatsoever to what is recorded in the audio". The video is from Rahul's meeting with Father George Ponnaiah.

242.title: My 2 properties in Goa have been grabbed: Indian-origin UK Home Secretary's father
242.article_body: Indian-origin UK Home Secretary Suella Braverman's father has complained that his two ancestral properties in North Goa have been grabbed by an unidentified person. Braverman was appointed as UK's new Home Secretary by Prime Minister Liz Truss earlier this week. The Special Investigation Team of the state police has filed a case and launched a probe, an official said.

243.title: 2 Hyderabad bank officials jailed for 5 years in cheating case
243.article_body: The Special Judge for CBI cases, Hyderabad, on Friday sentenced two officials of Indian Overseas Bank (IOB) to five years of rigorous imprisonment. In 2003, the then Chief Manager of IOB Hyderabad's main branch Souman Chakraborthy and his senior manager Sankaraman Padmanabhan had allegedly sanctioned 13 housing loans based on fake IT returns and fake title deeds as collateral security.

244.title: Differently-abled woman gang-raped in Maharashtra's Jalna, 3 arrested
244.article_body: A differently-abled woman was gang-raped by five men at a village in Maharashtra's Jalna district, police said on Saturday. The incident reportedly took place on August 28 and came to light earlier this week after the family members of the victim found out about the assault. Three of the five accused have been arrested, police added.

245.title: CCI dismisses JSW Paints' plea against Asian Paints alleging abuse of dominance
245.article_body: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) ruled in favour of Asian Paints and dismissed a complaint by JSW Paints alleging that the former blocked its entry into the decorative paints segment by abusing the market dominance. The probe found that Asian Paints' actions were "based on objective criteria and uniformly applicable practice of Asian Paints to protect its business interest".

246.title: Students protest over temple construction on B'luru university campus
246.article_body: Bangalore University (BU) students on Thursday protested against the construction of a Ganesha temple on the campus. They said University Grants Commission's guidelines forbade the building of religious structures in public-run institutions. Officials said a temple was earlier demolished on the campus for widening of a road, following which BU decided to shift the temple elsewhere on the campus.

247.title: UN chief Guterres visits areas of Pakistan devastated by floods
247.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres, along with Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif, on Saturday visited several areas of Pakistan ravaged by floods as he rounded off a two-day trip to the country. "Pakistan needs massive financial support. This is not a matter of generosity, it's a matter of justice," Guterres said. Pakistan has put the cost of flood-related damage at $30 billion.

248.title: Adani's ₹31,000-cr open offer for ACC, Ambuja not fully subscribed
248.article_body: Adani Group's open offer for the acquisition of a 26% stake in Swiss firm Holcim's two Indian-listed entities, ACC Limited and Ambuja Cements, for ₹31,000 crore closed without being fully subscribed. As on Friday, 40.61 lakh shares of the 4.8 crore ACC shares were tendered. For Ambuja Cements, 7.2 lakh shares of the 51.6 crore shares were tendered.

249.title: Was dreaming of this moment: Alcaraz on reaching maiden Grand Slam final
249.article_body: After reaching his maiden Grand Slam final at US Open 2022, 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz said, "I thought about a young man like 10 years ago dreaming of this moment right now." Alcaraz beat Frances Tiafoe 6-7(6-8), 6-3, 6-1, 6-7(5-7), 6-3. He's the second teenager since American Pete Sampras in 1990 to enter the US Open final in the Open Era.

250.title: Man chops off tongue, offers it at Maa Sheetla temple in UP
250.article_body: A 38-year-old man chopped off his tongue using a blade at Maa Sheetla temple in Uttar Pradesh's Kaushambi district and offered it to the deity, said police on Saturday. The devotee, Sampat, has been admitted to the district hospital, where his condition is said to be serious. He was accompanied by his wife, Banno Devi, to the temple.

251.title: Delhi’s Bawana lake to be revamped as a picnic spot
251.article_body: Delhi government will build a park around Sanoth lake in the neighbourhood of Bawana and revamp it into a picnic spot. The park will have a children's playground, a picnic area, a walkway, a Chhath Puja ghat and a public outdoor gym. Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has also directed the officials to make educational paintings on the lake's boundary wall.

252.title: Car rams into railing, falls off flyover in Punjab; 3 dead, 1 hurt
252.article_body: A woman, her mother-in-law and her son's friend died after a car they were travelling in rammed into the railing and then fell off the Ladhowal flyover in Punjab's Ludhiana on Friday. The woman's husband, who was also in the car, suffered severe injuries and is admitted to a hospital. The group was travelling to attend the son's marriage ritual.

253.title: ASI shoots himself dead inside police station in Punjab, records video blaming senior
253.article_body: An assistant sub-inspector named Satish Kumar shot himself dead with his service revolver inside Hariana police station in Punjab's Hoshiarpur after allegedly being humiliated by his senior. The 52-year-old recorded a video, wherein he blamed Tanda SHO Onkar Singh for his death. The SHO has been transferred to police line and a probe has been ordered, police said.

254.title: 55-yr-old pedestrian run over by police constable in Mumbai, held
254.article_body: A 55-year-old pedestrian, Vakil Salim Ansari, was killed after a car driven by a police constable ran over him in south Mumbai, police said on Saturday. The accused policeman was arrested on Friday and an offence was registered against him at Tardeo police station. The accident took place on Thursday night while Ansari was crossing the road, police said.

255.title: Lightning strikes road in Maha’s Nashik amid heavy rains, video surfaces
255.article_body: A video of lightning striking amid heavy rains in Maharashtra's Nashik has surfaced online. In the video, vehicles can be seen moving on the road. The video further shows lightning striking the road. Sparks can be seen blowing up behind the moving vehicles. Reports said that the incident took place in Nashik's JMCT College area.

256.title: Amit Shah lays foundation stone of Tanot Temple Complex in Rajasthan
256.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah laid the foundation stone of the Tanot Temple Complex Project, which is adjacent to the India-Pakistan international border and is around 120 km from Jaisalmer, Rajasthan. Over ₹17 crore has been approved by the Centre for the project. Centre is planning to make a waiting room, amphitheatre, room for children and other necessary facilities.

257.title: We should celebrate achievements of Indian scientists: PM Modi
257.article_body: After inaugurating the 'Centre-State Science Conclave' in Ahmedabad on Saturday, PM Narendra Modi said achievements of Indian scientists during the last century weren't "celebrated" adequately, as it should have been done. "Due to this...large part of our society remained indifferent to science," he said, adding, when we celebrate our scientists' achievements, science becomes part of our culture.

258.title: Over 2,100 cattle found infected with lumpy skin disease in 10 MP districts
258.article_body: 2,171 cattle have been found infected with the lumpy skin disease across 10 districts of Madhya Pradesh. Following this, the administration has banned the transportation of bovine animals in the affected parts of the state. State Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan has directed officials to take extra precautions in the adjoining areas of the disease-affected districts.

259.title: 5 Hong Kong speech therapists jailed over 'seditious' children's books
259.article_body: Five Hong Kong speech therapists were jailed for 19 months for conspiracy to publish 'seditious' children's books. Prosecutors had deemed the books, which depicted sheep trying to defend their village from wolves, anti-government. Prosecutors said the animals were analogies for Hong Kong residents and mainland Chinese authorities respectively and were intended to incite hatred towards the latter.

260.title: Gal Gadot to play Evil Queen in 'Snow White' film
260.article_body: Actress Gal Gadot has been roped in to play Evil Queen in the upcoming live-action film 'Snow White'. The titular character will be played by 'West Side Story' star Rachel Zegler. Based on Disney's 'Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs', which was released in 1937, the upcoming project will be directed by Marc Webb. It will release in 2024.

261.title: Fadnavis criticises Maha Vikas Aghadi over beautification of Memon’s grave
261.article_body: Reacting to the controversy around beautification of Mumbai blasts convict Yakub Memon’s grave, Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis criticised the previous Maha Vikas Aghadi government. “We have seen who gives protection to convicts in Mumbai blast case. His companions who were made ministers are still in jail. We convicted the guilty of blasts by opening SC at night,” said Fadnavis.

262.title: Doesn't matter where you come from, here's to big dreams: Kriti on Filmfare win
262.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon, who won the Filmfare Best Actress award for 'Mimi', said in her acceptance speech that it doesn't matter where you come from or what your surname is. "It's taken me eight years, it might take you a little longer...but just believe in yourself...Never let anyone tell you your dream is too big...Here's to big dreams," she said.

263.title: Top seeds Ram-Salisbury win their 2nd straight men's doubles US Open title
263.article_body: Top seeds Rajeev Ram and Joe Salisbury beat second seeds Wesley Koolhof and Neal Skupski 7-6(7-4), 7-5 to win their second successive men's doubles title at US Open. With this, Ram and Salisbury have become the first men's team to defend their title at US Open since Australian duo of Todd Woodbridge and Mark Woodforde in 1996.

264.title: 14-year-old girl married off to 46-year-old man in K'taka; 3 arrested
264.article_body: A 14-year-old girl was married off to a 46-year-old man in Bengaluru. The girl's parents and husband, N Guruprasad, have been arrested on charges of child marriage, said police. Guruprasad is said to have convinced the girl's parents to marry their daughter to him for ₹15,000. The parents told the police that they agreed out of poverty.

265.title: Suggested use of skybuses in Bengaluru: Gadkari on improving mobility
265.article_body: Talking about improving road infrastructure and mobility in Bengaluru, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said that the Centre would study introducing skybuses and building flyovers. "We are working on public transport on electricity. Technology has changed a lot. It's difficult to acquire land in Bengaluru. So, I suggested the use of skybuses like in the Philippines and other countries," said Gadkari.

266.title: Kejriwal govt spent ₹168 cr for over 4 lakh patients since 2017: Sisodia
266.article_body: Arvind Kejriwal-led government has spent ₹168.43 crore to provide healthcare facilities to over 4.27 lakh patients in Delhi between 2017 and March 2022, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said on Friday. He also added that there are several schemes where the government provides financial support for patients' medical implants, surgeries, 136 types of medical tests and treatment of accident victims.

267.title: Congress wants to loot the poor people of Chhattisgarh: JP Nadda
267.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda criticised Congress and alleged that the party wants to loot the people of Chhattisgarh and fill the party’s treasury. "The Congress government in Chhattisgarh has stalled several ongoing development projects in the state. They never want development of the society. They want to become the Congress party’s ATM," said Nadda.

268.title: India’s Global Innovation Index ranking improved from 81 to 46: PM Modi
268.article_body: PM Narendra Modi hailed Centre’s science and technology-based development model and said that India’s Global Innovation Index ranking improved from 81 in 2015 to 46 at present due to the government’s efforts. "We have to make India a global centre of research and innovation in this Amrit Kaal. States should adopt best practices from other states," said PM Modi.

269.title: Dravid is aware that the honeymoon period is over: Ex-selector Karim
269.article_body: Ex-selector Saba Karim said India head coach Rahul Dravid is aware that the "honeymoon period" is over. "He's trying his best to be an alchemist but so far, such metals haven't been converted into core," added Karim. Karim stated that Dravid would "love" to swap India's triumphs in bilateral matches with the defeat in the recent fifth Test against England.

270.title: Google pays 'enormous' sums to remain top search engine: US DOJ
270.article_body: US Department of Justice (DOJ) has said Google pays "enormous" sums annually to Apple, Samsung and other telecom companies to unlawfully remain the top search engine. Google spends billions to buy "default exclusivity" on most browsers and all US mobile phones, DOJ told a federal judge on Thursday. The comments come in an antitrust lawsuit filed by DOJ in 2020.

271.title: They'll get tired one day: Kamra on right-wing groups' threats against show
271.article_body: Comedian Kunal Kamra took to Instagram to react to right-wing groups threatening to protest and disrupt his show at a bar in Gurugram if it wasn't cancelled, saying, "They'll get tired one day or I'll be irrelevant, don't know which one will be sooner." This comes as the bar's management cancelled the show. Kamra "mocks Hindu deities", right-wing groups claimed.

272.title: India's forex reserves fall to lowest level in nearly 2 years, drop below $560 billion
272.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves fell to their lowest level in nearly two years, data released by the Reserve Bank of India on Friday showed. The reserves fell by $7.94 billion to $553.1 billion as of September 2, marking the lowest level since October 9, 2020. The decline was led by a drop in foreign currency assets to $492.1 billion.

273.title: We were probably like dying: Ruud on 55-shot rally in US Open semi
273.article_body: Discussing the 55-shot rally in the first set of his US Open semi-final against Russia's Karen Khachanov, Norwegian tennis player Casper Ruud said, "We were...probably like dying because we were out of breath." "I felt my knees or my legs were sort of shaking," added Ruud. "I tried to not...[let] Karen feel that I am tired," he stated.

274.title: Man crashes lover's wedding in Chennai, tries to tie 'mangalsutra'
274.article_body: A 24-year-old man crashed his lover's wedding in Chennai and tried to tie 'thali' ('mangalsutra'), which he snatched from the priest, around her neck on Friday. He came to the marriage hall after the 20-year-old bride texted him to come and get her. The man was beaten up by people but he managed to stop the wedding.

275.title: Newborn girl found abandoned in Mumbai, people call police for adoption
275.article_body: A newborn girl was found abandoned near a dustbin in Mumbai's Borivali (West) area on Wednesday night. Following the incident, a police officer shared a post on Facebook and a few families contacted him expressing willingness to adopt the girl. "If she gets adopted, it would be great," said Senior Inspector Sudhir Kudalkar, who had shared the post.

276.title: Shah Rukh Khan shouldn't collaborate with me right now: Ali Zafar
276.article_body: Actor Ali Zafar in an interview stated that actor Shah Rukh Khan should not collaborate with him right now. "Wahan pe aise hi mushkilein badh jaati hain (Difficulties can increase there just like that)," the actor added. The All Indian Cine Workers Association had announced a total ban on Pakistani artistes after the Pulwama terror attack in 2019.

277.title: 'Brahmāstra' earns ₹75 crore worldwide on opening day
277.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt starrer 'Brahmāstra Part One: Shiva' has opened at worldwide gross collection of ₹75 crore. Sharing the update, the film's producer Karan Johar wrote on Instagram, "Humbled...Grateful...but yet can't control my excitement!" The film reportedly collected ₹35-36 crore in all versions at the domestic box office on the first day.

278.title: Teabag said to have been used by UK Queen put on sale for ₹9.5 lakh on eBay
278.article_body: A teabag believed to have been used by Queen Elizabeth, was put on sale on eBay for $12,000 (around ₹9.56 lakh), after her death. "This is the very teabag you might have seen on CNN in late 1998. Own a piece of History! Priceless!" said the listing. The listing has now ended and it indicates the product has been sold.

279.title: Charles proclaimed King at ceremony in London
279.article_body: Charles has been proclaimed King at the Accession Council at St James' Palace in London after the passing away of his mother Elizabeth II. The ceremony was attended by his wife, Camilla, and the heir to the throne, William. Later in the day, Senior MPs will swear an oath of allegiance to King Charles III in the Houses of Parliament.

280.title: An adventure for the big screen, can't wait for part 2: Arjun on 'Brahmāstra'
280.article_body: Arjun Kapoor took to Instagram Stories to appreciate Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmāstra'. He wrote, "An adventure for the big screen...A ride like no other...Loved watching @ayan_mukerji's vision come to life." He further wrote, "From...King Khans surprise emergence (loved it) to nag sirs action sequences...this one is a sure shot cinematic experience...cannot wait for part 2!!!"

281.title: Chadwick Boseman honoured with Disney Legends Award posthumously
281.article_body: Late actor Chadwick Boseman, known for portraying 'Black Panther', was honoured with the Disney Legends Award posthumously on Friday at D23 Expo. His brother Derrick Boseman accepted the trophy on his behalf. Derrick said in his speech, "[Chadwick] honoured his scripts with his love, his blood, his sweat, his tears. As he played these roles, he was taking chemo simultaneously."

282.title: Pitiable: Baghel on BJP sharing pic of Rahul's Burberry t-shirt
282.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel reacted to BJP sharing a picture of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi wearing a Burberry t-shirt, which reportedly costs ₹41,257, saying, "This is pitiable...when one party is uniting the country, the party that's dividing...is clinging to t-shirts and khaki shorts." Congress leader Pawan Khera also reacted to this, saying, "Those with shorts will only look at...t-shirt."

283.title: State-run OMCs to run fuel stations on solar power by 2024: Govt
283.article_body: The Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas said that all state-run oil marketing companies (OMCs) will run their entire network of petrol and diesel retail stations on solar power by 2024. OMCs, including Indian Oil Corporation Ltd, Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd and Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd, together have around 75,000 fuel stations across India that will deploy solar panels.

284.title: India, US to hold next Trade Policy Forum meet soon: Piyush Goyal
284.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal said India and the US will hold the next ministerial-level meeting of the Trade Policy Forum (TPF) in US soon. He further said that officials from both countries will firm up more deliverables and newer areas of engagement. Goyal also held a bilateral meeting with US Trade Representative Katherine Tai and US Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo.

285.title: Certain people enjoy masala: Rakul on romance angle in 'Cuttputlli'
285.article_body: Speaking about 'Cuttputlli' being criticised for the romance angle, actress Rakul Preet Singh said that Indian films are known for the "quintessential masala". She added that there is a certain section of the audience that enjoys the romance and song-dance. "People want entertainment...If the story is thrilling and intense, a little bit of breather...makes it a family watch," Rakul said.

286.title: I'm scared of snakes, shot scene with real snake thinking it was fake: Big B
286.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan has revealed that he is scared of snakes and recalled an incident when he had to shoot a scene with a snake coming out of his chest. "They told me that we will keep a fake rubber snake...During the shoot, I was holding the snake...Later I got to know...the snake was not fake, it was...real," he said.

287.title: 5 killed after boat collides with whale in New Zealand: Report
287.article_body: Five people were reportedly killed after a small charter boat collided with a whale and capsized in New Zealand. The accident took place on Saturday morning near the South Island town of Kaikoura. The town is a popular whale-watching destination, while sperm whales are usually seen in the area. Some humpback whales also pass through.

288.title: 'Brahmāstra' ending is superb, but it will take time to build: Neetu
288.article_body: In a video shared by a media account, veteran actress Neetu Kapoor can be heard telling 'Brahmāstra' director Ayan Mukerji that the film's ending is superb. She can further be heard saying, "It is outstanding, amazing. But it will...initially it takes time to build. But once the film takes off." The video was taken at a special screening of 'Brahmāstra'.

289.title: The real Kohli wasn't batting during the first 50 runs: Akhtar on Kohli's 122*
289.article_body: Shoaib Akhtar said the "real Virat Kohli" wasn't batting during the first 50 runs of Kohli's 122* (61) in the Asia Cup match against Afghanistan. Akhtar added that he saw the real Kohli bat during the last 50 runs of the knock. Talking about Virat Kohli being a potential opener in T20Is, Akhtar stated, "Don't get confused...thinking [like] that."

290.title: Teacher pours boiling water on 7-yr-old boy for defecating in school uniform in K'taka
290.article_body: A 7-year-old Class 2 student suffered 40% burns after his teacher allegedly threw hot water on him for defecating in his school uniform in Karnataka's Raichur district, police said. The boy has been admitted to Lingasugur taluk hospital and is undergoing treatment. "We have information about the incident but haven't received any complaint regarding the matter," police added.

291.title: At least 3 killed, 11 injured as trains collide in Croatia
291.article_body: At least three people were killed and 11 others were injured after a passenger train and freight train collided on Friday night in Croatia, authorities said. Both trains were pushed off the rails after the collision. The passenger train was carrying 13 people, while the engine driver was the only person in the freight train, Croatian PM Andrej Plenkovic said.

292.title: Police bust Lashkar-e-Taiba terror module in J&K's Sopore, 2 arrested
292.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir Police on Friday arrested two people from Sopore after busting an overground worker (OGW) module of the Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT). Police also recovered two grenades from the arrested persons, ANI reported. During the inquiry, the detained pair divulged identities of other OGW accomplices, leading to the arrest and recovery of more weaponry and ammunition, reports added.

293.title: Construction material falls on workers in Noida; 1 dead, 4 injured
293.article_body: A 22-year-old labourer was killed and four others were injured after construction material fell on them when the rope tied around it broke in Noida on Friday. The construction material, which included iron rods, was attached to a tower crane, the police said. An FIR has been filed against four people including the construction company's director, Additional DCP (Noida) said.

294.title: India skips US-led IPEF's trade pillar, to join 3 other pillars
294.article_body: India has not joined the US-led Indo-Pacific Economic Framework for Prosperity's (IPEF) 'trade pillar'. US Trade Representative Katherine Tai said, "I wouldn't characterise it as opting out, India isn't in...trade pillar right now." She added India and US have their bilateral and trade policy forum. However, India will join the three other pillars–supply chain, clean economy and fair economy.

295.title: Yami's 'Lost' to premiere at Chicago South Asian Film Fest opening night
295.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam has announced that her film 'Lost' will be premiering on the opening night of the 13th Annual Chicago South Asian Film Festival. The event will be attended by director Aniruddha Roy Chowdhury, Yami and actor Rahul Khanna. The film will premiere on September 23 and will be followed by a question-answer session with the team of 'Lost'.

296.title: Reliance arm to buy SPL, SPTex's polyester business for ₹1,592 cr
296.article_body: Reliance Petroleum Retail Limited, a subsidiary of Reliance Industries Limited, will acquire the polyester business of Shubhalakshmi Polyesters Limited (SPL) and Shubhlaxmi Polytex Limited (SPTex) for ₹1,522 crore and ₹70 crore, respectively in a slump sale on a going concern basis. The acquisitions are subject to approvals from the Competition Commission of India and the lenders of SPL and SPTex.

297.title: Amazon to stop selling seat belt alarm blockers in US, UK after Mistry's car crash
297.article_body: Amazon will remove listings of products that disable car seat belt alarms in US and UK, a day after the e-commerce platform did the same in India. The development comes after former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry died in a car crash last weekend. Mistry, who was in the rear seat, wasn't wearing seat belt at the time of crash.

298.title: Pics show cards, balloons, flowers at gates of Buckingham Palace after Queen's demise
298.article_body: People in the UK paid their respects to Queen Elizabeth II after her demise by leaving flowers, balloons and cards among other things at the gates of the Buckingham Palace in London. Thousands of people gathered outside Buckingham Palace amid rain. Portraits of the Queen were reportedly posted on billboard screens in central London's Piccadilly Circus and Canary Wharf.

299.title: Mining mafia attacks police, officials in Haryana's Nuh; 50 booked
299.article_body: A police constable was injured after the mining mafia attacked a joint team of police and other officials during a raid at an illegal mining site in Haryana's Nuh, police said on Friday. A juvenile was apprehended and an FIR has been filed against some identified people and around 40-50 unidentified people, a police officer said.

300.title: 14 cows die at Ludhiana shelter, contaminated fodder suspected
300.article_body: At least 14 cows were found dead at a shelter in the Samrala town of Ludhiana district on Friday. Dr Jaswinder Kaur, a veterinary specialist, suspected it to be a case of contaminated fodder after traces of nitrate were found in it. She said that fodder producers spray chemicals to increase yield, which could prove fatal if fed directly.

301.title: Shah Rukh Khan appointed as ambassador by UAE's Burjeel Holdings
301.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan has been appointed as the brand ambassador for UAE's private healthcare services provider Burjeel Holdings. Burjeel Holdings is owned by UAE-based Indian entrepreneur Shamsheer Vayalil. This is Shah Rukh's first role as a healthcare ambassador. The actor said, "Meeting employees and witnessing the immense passion and pride they have in their work was humbling."

302.title: Nurse saves baby who stopped breathing on US flight; video surfaces
302.article_body: A nurse on board a Spirit Airlines flight from US' Pittsburgh to Orlando saved a baby who'd stopped breathing midair on Thursday. The video of the incident was shared by Ian Cassette, a meteorologist for Fox 35 television station in Orlando, on Twitter. According to the meteorologist, the three-month-old baby's lips had gone purple, following which nurse Tamara Panzino intervened.

303.title: 4 including 2 minor brothers die after taking 70-80 feet fall as SUV hits bike in Nagpur
303.article_body: Four members of a family were killed after they were flung into air when a Sports Utility Vehicle (SUV) rammed into their motorcycle in Maharashtra's Nagpur on Friday, police said. Reports said that the four deceased took a 70 to 80 feet fall before they died. Among the deceased are two minor boys, aged five and eleven years.

304.title: Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie donates 2 mansions in California worth $55 million
304.article_body: MacKenzie Scott, the ex-wife of Amazon Founder and the world's second richest person Jeff Bezos, has donated two mansions in California's Beverly Hills for a total of $55 million. Bezos and Scott had purchased the properties while they were married. Scott received sole ownership of these homes following her divorce from Bezos in 2019 after 25 years of marriage.

305.title: If I was Rohit, I'd tell Avesh 'Tell me if you can't bowl 140+': Akram
305.article_body: Sharing the conversation he would have with pacer Avesh Khan if he was Rohit Sharma, Wasim Akram said, "I'll tell...Avesh, 'I want you to bowl over 140 kmph, if you can't bowl...tell me'." "I don't want...135 kmph line, length bowlers," added Akram. "If Avesh cannot [bowl quick] what's the point of having him in the team," he stated.

306.title: Former RJD MLC's son arrested for misbehaving with DSP in Patna
306.article_body: Former RJD MLC Anwar Ahmed's son Afshar was arrested for allegedly misbehaving with the DSP and others inside a police station in Bihar's Patna on Friday. Afshar was reportedly forcing police to let a man go who allegedly attacked police during a raid. "He (Afshar) said...he'll come back with 5,000 people and give it a different angle," the DSP said.

307.title: If stray dogs attack people, those who feed them could be held liable: Supreme Court
307.article_body: While hearing petitions in connection with the stray dogs' menace in Kerala, Supreme Court Justice Sanjiv Khanna said that people who feed stray dogs "will be responsible for vaccinating them and bearing the cost if a person is attacked". The Supreme Court bench said that a balance has to be maintained between the safety of people and animal rights.

308.title: PM Modi inaugurates 2-day Centre-State Science Conclave virtually
308.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday inaugurated the Centre-State Science Conclave being held from September 10 to 11 in Ahmedabad via video conferencing. "Investment in science and technology has increased since 2014," he said. "We have to make India a global centre of research and innovation in this 'Amrit Kaal'. States should adopt best practices from other states," he added.

309.title: 1.8-million-year-old human tooth found in Georgia; pic released
309.article_body: A 1.8-million-year-old tooth belonging to an early species of human has been found by archaeologists in Georgia. The tooth was discovered near the village of Orozmani, around 100 km southwest of the Georgian capital of Tbilisi. The village is near Dmanisi where human skulls dated to 1.8 million years old were found in the late 1990s and early 2000s.

310.title: I'm from middle-class family, watched films only when I scored well: Rakul
310.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh has said that she comes from a middle-class family and could not watch all the films that were released when she was growing up. "My dad would say, 'Okay, you score well. So you watch that film, you do this.' So...it was tough," the actress added. Rakul was last seen in Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Cuttputlli'.

311.title: Bolsonaro supporter kills Lula fan as Brazil Prez election nears
311.article_body: Ahead of the Brazilian Presidential polls in October, a supporter of President Jair Bolsonaro killed a backer of rival candidate Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva during an argument, authorities said on Friday. The 24-year-old accused has been arrested, police said, adding that Rafael Silva de Oliveira has confessed to the crime. Bolsonaro is currently trailing in the polls.

312.title: Alia Bhatt is the most focused actor in film industry: Shefali Shah
312.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah has stated in an interview that Alia Bhatt is the most focused actor in the film industry. The two shared screen space together in Alia's first production venture 'Darlings'. Speaking about her career, Shefali said her potential was not tapped well before she did the series 'Delhi Crime', adding, "Better late than never perfectly describes my journey."

313.title: Please don't leak spoilers of 'Brahmāstra' on social media: Ranbir
313.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, who recently held a special screening of 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva' for fans, requested them not to leak any spoilers on social media. He can be heard saying in a video, "The audience who has not seen it would like to experience it." Ranbir also signed autographs and clicked selfies with fans at the event.

314.title: Ex-Tesla CFO Deepak Ahuja to join US drone delivery startup Zipline
314.article_body: Ex-Tesla CFO Deepak Ahuja will join San Francisco-based drone delivery startup Zipline as its first Chief Business and Financial Officer. "Rarely do I see this level of disruption and impact paired with the world-class technology that Zipline's team is building," Ahuja said. He'll be leaving his post of CFO at Alphabet's Verily Life Sciences to join Zipline on September 30.

315.title: 3 people try to sell baby girl for ₹4.5 lakh, arrested in Faridabad
315.article_body: Haryana CM's Flying Squad has arrested three people after they were caught red-handed while trying to sell a six-month-old girl in Faridabad. A member of the squad had posed as a buyer and the trio agreed to sell the baby for ₹4.5 lakh, officials said. The trio revealed that they'd sold a child earlier in Delhi, a sub-inspector said.

316.title: 'After Aashiqui 2', 'Ek Villain', I thought I'll write a book: Shraddha
316.article_body: Actress Shraddha Kapoor recently launched the book 'Treasure Trove' written by 8-year-old Arya and read out a chapter at the event. Shraddha said she thought it would be great to write a book. "It was around 2014, my film 'Aashiqui 2' had already released, later 'Ek Villain' released as well...I...started understanding the creative process of what I do," she added.

317.title: Rahul Gandhi begins 4th day of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' from Kanniyakumari
317.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi began the fourth day of the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' from Kanniyakumari's Mulagumoodu on Saturday. The party aims to cover about 3,570 km journey from Kanniyakumari to Kashmir during the campaign which kicked off on Wednesday. On Friday, Gandhi said the 'yatra' is an attempt to "undo the damage caused by the BJP and RSS".

318.title: Have always tried to maintain harmony with govt: Raj Guv Kalraj Mishra
318.article_body: Rajasthan Governor Kalraj Mishra said that he has always tried to maintain harmony with Ashok Gehlot-led Congress government in the state. "If there is a difficulty at any level and of any kind, then it is addressed through continuous dialogue and communication," Mishra said while talking to reporters to mark the completion of his three years as Governor of Rajasthan.

319.title: Journalist Siddique likely to be released next week from UP jail: Official
319.article_body: Journalist Siddique Kappan who was arrested under Unlawful Activities Prevention Act (UAPA) is likely to be released from the Lucknow jail next week, an official said. SC granted him bail on Friday and stated that every person has right to free expression. He was arrested while he was on his way to Hathras where a Dalit woman had died.

320.title: UK envoy condoles Queen's demise in Hindi, says 'Maharani Elizabeth ko yaad kiya jayega'
320.article_body: British High Commissioner to India Alex Ellis spoke in Hindi while condoling Queen Elizabeth II's demise. "Maharani Elizabeth ko unke jeevan, nishtha...aur kartaviya seva ke liye United Kingdom,  Bharat, Commonwealth ke desho, puri duniya mein yaad kiya jayega...Queen Elizabeth had a long life, an exemplary life of strength, duty, hard work and dignity," Ellis said.

321.title: King Charles told Harry not to bring wife Meghan to see dying Queen: Report
321.article_body: King Charles told his son Harry not to bring wife Meghan Markle to Balmoral Castle as he and other senior Royals rushed to see dying Queen, a source told The Sun. "Charles made it very, very clear Meghan would not be welcome," the source reportedly said. Harry was at Frogmore Cottage when he received a call from his father.

322.title: Car in Mistry's accident was at 100 kmph speed seconds before crash: Mercedes report
322.article_body: The car in which former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was killed, was running at a speed of 100 kmph seconds before the accident, according to a preliminary report submitted by Mercedes-Benz. Its speed was 89 kmph when it hit the divider, Palghar Superintendent of Police said citing the report, adding that the brakes were applied five seconds before crash.

323.title: I signed 3 films even after 'Love Aaj Kal 2' flopped: Kartik Aaryan
323.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has stated in an interview that he signed three films after the critical and commercial failure of 2020 film 'Love Aaj Kal 2'. "After playing two roles in the film, filmmakers started seeing me in that light," he said. The actor further said that director Imtiaz Ali's "magic" presented his serious side in the film.

324.title: India reports 5,554 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 48,850
324.article_body: India has reported 5,554 fresh COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The data showed that 6,322 people recovered in the last 24 hours. This comes a day after 6,093 COVID-19 cases were reported in the country. Active cases in India stand at 48,850.

325.title: Instagram tests 'reposts' feature for resharing posts in feed
325.article_body: Meta's Instagram is testing a new feature that will allow users to repost other users' posts in their own feeds. "We plan to test this soon with a small number of people," Meta said. Currently, users can share someone's posts in their Stories. Reportedly, users will be able to see all reshared posts in a separate tab on their profiles.

326.title: 'Machis ki dibbi' worth thousands of crores: Baghel on ministry building
326.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel called the ministry building in Naya Raipur a 'machis ki dibbi' (matchbox). Calling it a symbol of corruption, he alleged that the BJP spent thousands of crores of rupees to build it but it is in ruins today. "When the wind blows, the walls shake and the windows rattle," he said.

327.title: Copyright lawsuit against Fortis Healthcare dismissed by US court
327.article_body: A US court dismissed a copyright lawsuit filed by Emqore Envesecure against Fortis Healthcare and others, including IHH Healthcare Berhad, Fortis said. The suit was dismissed on grounds of 'forum non conveniens', which is a discretionary power allowing courts to dismiss a case where another court/forum is better suited to hear the case. Emqore had sought $6.5 billion in damages.

328.title: 19-yr-old who put college on hold to build his crypto startup raises $30 mn in US
328.article_body: Tate Berenbaum, the 19-year-old Founder of Community Labs, has raised $30 million in funding for his crypto startup. Berenbaum told Bloomberg that he has moved to New York and has put his first year at the University of Virginia on hold to build the startup. He further said he spent most of the time coding in his basement during COVID-19.

329.title: My wife & 2 kids perished, I lost everything: Then Taj hotel GM on 26/11 attacks
329.article_body: Karambir Kang, who was the Taj Mahal Palace hotel's General Manager during 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks, urged the international community at a UN convention to act against terrorism. "My wife and two young sons could not escape and died during the attack, I lost everything...Our company and staff...have spent 14 long and painful years trying to seek justice," he said.

330.title: Everything runs on fakeness in Bollywood: Vivek on 'Brahmāstra'
330.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri shared a report saying 'Brahmāstra' led to ₹800 crore loss for two theatre chains, writing on Twitter, "Problem is everything runs on fakeness in Bollywood." The filmmaker further wrote, "And nobody is answerable. No industry can survive which invests 0% in R&D and wastes 70-80% money on stars." 'Brahmāstra' features Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt and Amitabh Bachchan.

331.title: Missing boy found murdered in Pune; father received ₹20 cr ransom call
331.article_body: A seven-year-old boy, who was reported missing, was found murdered on the premises of a company on Friday in Pune's Pimpri Chinchwad, police said. The father of the boy, who was last seen playing near his residence, had allegedly received a ransom call demanding ₹20 crore. The police said that they're investigating to confirm the cause behind the murder.

332.title: FM Sitharaman asks RBI to prepare 'whitelist' of legal loan apps
332.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has asked the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) to prepare a "whitelist" of all the legal lending apps to single out those illegal apps using unethical means to exploit customers. The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology will ensure that app stores such as Google Play Store or Apple App Store only host these "whitelist" apps.

333.title: A threat to peace: France on North Korea's new nuclear law
333.article_body: France condemned North Korea's new law, which allows it to carry out a preemptive nuclear attack to protect itself. "This new escalation on the part of...North Korea...represents a threat to international and regional peace and security," French Foreign Ministry said. North Korean leader Kim Jong-un called the decision "irreversible" and ruled out the possibility of any talks on denuclearisation.

334.title: Kunal Kamra's Gurugram show cancelled after threats by VHP, Bajrang Dal
334.article_body: The management of a bar in Gurugram has cancelled comedian Kunal Kamra's show, scheduled to take place on September 17 and 18, after members of Bajrang Dal and Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) threatened to protest. In a memorandum submitted to the deputy commissioner, right-wing groups claimed Kamra "mocks Hindu deities in his shows" and requested the show to be cancelled.

335.title: Lucknow hotel fire probe report submitted, 6 depts held responsible; action suggested
335.article_body: Probe report about Hotel Levana fire mishap has been submitted to the state government. The report has held six departments including Lucknow Development Authority (LDA), Lucknow Electricity Supply Administration (LESA), Fire Services, Excise Department, District Administration and Lucknow Municipal Corporation responsible for the incident. Action has been suggested against several officers.

336.title: Don't want SC to be 'tareekh pe tareekh' court: Justice Chandrachud
336.article_body: The Supreme Court refused to grant an adjournment sought by a counsel in a case on Friday. Justice DY Chandrachud said, "We don't want the Supreme Court to be 'tareekh pe tareekh' court. We want to change this perception." "This is the highest court of the land and we want certain dignity to be attached to this court," he added.

337.title: Kangana meets President, says she looks like a goddess on her throne
337.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut on Friday shared pictures on social media of meeting President Droupadi Murmu. The actress wrote alongside the pictures, "Her gentle voice, calm demeanour and compassionate gaze is another worldly...Sitting on that chair/ throne she looks nothing short of a goddess/ Shakti who nurtures, heals and guides." She further wrote that the President appreciated her for her work.

338.title: Artificial ponds to be constructed for immersion of idols in Delhi
338.article_body: Delhi Jal Board Vice Chairman Saurabh Bharadwaj has directed the administration to construct artificial ponds for immersion of idols ahead of Durga Puja festivity. "During Durga Puja in Delhi, huge crowds of devotees gather to celebrate. All necessary instructions have been given to the officials concerned to ensure that there is no problem during the immersion," said Bharadwaj.

339.title: Babar mouths 'I'm captain' after umpire signals DRS without his consent, video viral
339.article_body: A video went viral showing Pakistan captain Babar Azam repeatedly mouthing 'I am the captain' to umpire Anil Chaudhary after the latter signalled DRS without his consent during Sri Lanka's innings. Chaudhary signalled DRS after Muhammad Rizwan appealed for a caught behind and called for DRS. Babar suggested to Chaudhary that he can't signal DRS unless captain gives consent.

340.title: 'Brahmāstra' becomes biggest non-holiday Hindi release
340.article_body: Ayan Mukerji directorial 'Brahmāstra' earned ₹35-36 crore on its opening day, recording the biggest non-holiday opening for a Hindi film. The film's collection has beaten Ranbir Kapoor's highest opener so far 'Sanju' which earned ₹34.75 crore on its opening. SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion' holds the record for the highest opening on a non-holiday with a ₹41 crore collection.

341.title: Afg lose to everyone, they won't win unless fans change behaviour: Inzamam
341.article_body: Talking about the behaviour of the Afghanistan fans following their team's defeat against Pakistan, ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said, "I was really shocked...[and] disappointed." "Afghanistan lose to everyone...If the fans don't change their attitude, their team won't win going ahead also," added Inzamam. "It is the second time I am witnessing such shocking behaviour from them," he stated.

342.title: Will be successful in defeating BJP if Opposition is united: Tejashwi
342.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav pitched for Opposition unity for 2024 general elections. Talking about CM Nitish Kumar’s recent meetings with the Opposition leaders including Congress MP Rahul Gandhi in Delhi, he said, “It is a good thing. It has been clearly said that if all of us are united, we will be successful (in defeating BJP).”

343.title: King Charles kissed by woman as he greets people outside Buckingham Palace
343.article_body: Video showing a woman kissing King Charles III on the cheek as he greeted people outside the Buckingham Palace has surfaced online. The new monarch returned to London on Friday after being present when Queen Elizabeth II passed away at Balmoral on Thursday. Another woman was seen kissing the King on the hand.

344.title: IIT graduate fined ₹50,000 by Supreme Court over his 'Kashmir solution' petition
344.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday imposed a fine of ₹50,000 on an IIT graduate over his "Kashmir solution" petition. The petitioner named Prabhakar Venkatesh Deshpande sought implementation of Manmohan-Musharraf 4-point formula. The bench said it is putting the counsel for the petitioner on notice that it will impose cost on him for wasting the court's time with such petitions.

345.title: Virat Kohli's 122* has thrown a spanner in the works: Ravi Shastri
345.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said Virat Kohli's 122* (61) in the Asia Cup match against Afghanistan has "thrown" a "spanner in the works". "It's allowed now for the selectors to think, 'Do we need a third opener?'" added Shastri. "It allows you to have an extra pacer as well as an extra batter in the middle order," he stated.

346.title: BJP comes to Chhattisgarh to learn our development model: Baghel
346.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel criticised BJP and said that the BJP chief JP Nadda was visiting the state to study Congress' development model. "BJP comes here to learn our state model. Our schemes have been adopted by the Centre. BJP doesn't fight alone, uses agencies like ED, IT and CBI," added Baghel.

347.title: Musk cites Twitter's $7.75 mn payout to whistleblower as another reason to end deal
347.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk has sent a third letter to Twitter in an attempt to terminate his $44 billion acquisition of the company. Twitter's $7.75 million payment to whistleblower Peiter Zatko is a violation of merger agreement, Musk's lawyers said in latest notice.
