Twitter didn't seek Musk's consent for payment nor was it disclosed to him, they added.

348.title: Congress MP shares Sarma's 2010 tweet on Rahul, warns PM about Sarma
348.article_body: After Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma shared a parody video of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, party MP Manickam Tagore on Friday shared a picture of Sarma's 2010 tweet that said, "Rahul Gandhi will [be] Prime Minister of our country in an appropriate time." Tagore questioned whom Sarma was cheating and told PM Narendra Modi that he should "beware" of him.

349.title: BJP names former CM Biplab Deb for Rajya Sabha bypoll in Tripura
349.article_body: The BJP on Friday nominated former Tripura CM Biplab Kumar Deb as the party's candidate for the upcoming bypoll to the lone Rajya Sabha seat in the state. The seat fell vacant after Dr Manik Saha resigned following his appointment as Chief Minister of Tripura. Notably, the announcement came hours after Deb was made Haryana state in-charge by the party.

350.title: Will be more dangerous if jailed: Imran Khan amid terror charges
350.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan, who's facing terrorism charges, warned that he would become "more dangerous" if sent to jail. Khan also expressed discontent over the large police presence outside the Islamabad High Court during the hearing of the case on Thursday. Khan was booked under the Anti-Terrorism Act for allegedly threatening a judge and police officials at a rally.

351.title: 3 children drown during Ganesh idol immersion in Ganga river in UP
351.article_body: Two children drowned and one died during treatment after they went to immerse Ganesh idols in the Ganga river in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao, police said. The incident took place on Friday as the Ganesh Chaturthi festival came to an end. This comes as four children drowned in the Aami river during immersion of Ganesh idols in Sant Kabir Nagar.

352.title: 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz becomes youngest man to reach US Open final in 32 years
352.article_body: Spain's 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz has become the youngest man to reach US Open final since Pete Sampras (19 years) in 1990. The world number four defeated world number 26 France Tiafoe 6-7(6-8), 6-3, 6-1, 6-7(5-7), 6-3 in the US Open 2022 men's singles semi-final. Alcaraz has reached the final of a Grand Slam for the first time.

353.title: Bengaluru reports 337 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
353.article_body: Bengaluru reported 337 new COVID-19 infections on Friday, taking the cumulative total to 18,68,079 cases, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said. No new deaths were reported, so the overall toll remained at 16,983. The number of active cases was 2,733, while the infection positivity rate stood at 2.57%.

354.title: Man swims in living room of luxurious villa in flooded Bengaluru; video goes viral
354.article_body: A video showing a man swimming in the living room of a luxurious villa in Bengaluru's Epsilon amid severe waterlogging and floods has gone viral online. The video shows several household items floating around him and a piano submerged in water. Epsilon is home to many businessmen, such as Wipro Executive Chairman Rishad Premji and Britannia Managing Director Varun Berry.

355.title: Ukrainian soldiers write tributes to Queen on bombs before firing them at Russian forces
355.article_body: Ukrainian soldiers wrote tributes to Queen Elizabeth II, who passed away aged 96, on bombs before firing them at Russian forces. Pictures shared on Twitter by a user whose profile described him as a Ukrainian artilleryman in Kyiv's Air Assault Brigade showed "RIP Queen Elizabeth II" written on a bomb. Another picture showed tributes written in Ukrainian.

356.title: US payments company Bolt Financial scraps $1.5 bn deal to buy Wyre
356.article_body: Bolt Financial, the San Francisco-based online payments company, said on Friday that it has scrapped its $1.5 billion deal to buy cryptocurrency infrastructure provider Wyre Payments. Bolt Financial, however, said that it will continue its existing commercial partnership with Wyre Payments. Bolt Financial was valued at $11 billion after a funding round in January this year.

357.title: Chhattisgarh CM inaugurates 2 new districts in state, total district tally now 33
357.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel inaugurated Manendragarh-Chirmiri-Bharatpur and Sakti as the state's 32nd and 33rd districts on Friday. An official said that Sakti has been carved out from Janjgir-Champa while Manendragarh-Chirmiri-Bharatpur has been formed from Korea district. Baghel talked about long struggle to make Manendragarh-Chirmiri-Bharatpur a district.

358.title: Ukraine has retaken over 1,000 sq km since Sept 1: Zelenskyy
358.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy claimed that Kyiv's forces have "liberated" more than 1,000 sq km of territory since September 1. Over 30 settlements have been "liberated" in the Kharkiv region, Zelenskyy said. Russia's top official in Kharkiv region, Vitaly Ganchev, confirmed to Russian state TV that Ukrainians had broken through the Russian defence line and had won a "significant victory".

359.title: Congress to release white paper on 'flooded and potholed Bengaluru'
359.article_body: The Congress party said it has formed a committee to bring out a report titled 'Vision Bengaluru, Better Bengaluru' on the city's infrastructure within 20 days. AICC General Secretary Randeep Surjewala said that the committee would release a white paper on the 'flooded and potholed Bengaluru' within a week to "expose the maladministration and corruption".

360.title: Ashneer criticised for calling employees 'daily wagers in guise of salaried folk'
360.article_body: BharatPe's former MD Ashneer Grover was criticised after he called employees "daily wagers in guise of salaried folk" in response to EaseMyTrip Co-founder Prashant Pitti's post on hired candidates backing out at the last minute. A Twitter user wrote, "How do you manage to stoop so low?", while other replied, "Treat them like...daily wagers and they will act...like...daily wagers do."

361.title: ₹61.7 lakh-gold found under seat in flight, seized at Pune airport
361.article_body: Gold biscuits worth ₹61.7 lakh were seized after they were found hidden under the seat in a SpiceJet flight at the Pune International Airport, customs officials said on Friday. The gold biscuits were found in a pouch, wrapped by a black plastic sheet, Pune Customs said. It added that the gold biscuits weigh 1,166.4 gram and are of 999 purity.

362.title: Mason falls from 19th floor as lift cable snaps, dies in Gurugram
362.article_body: A 38-year-old mason died after allegedly falling from the 19th floor of an under-construction building when the cable of the lift he was repairing snapped in Gurugram's Sector 65, police said. The deceased's brother-in-law claimed that he died due to the "negligence of the contractor and builder as they had not provided...any safety equipment". The incident occurred on Wednesday.

363.title: Sweeper, guard die after inhaling toxic gases inside sewer in Delhi
363.article_body: Two men died after inhaling toxic gases while cleaning a sewer in Delhi's Bakkarwala area on Friday. According to police, the victims were identified as Rohit Chandilya, who worked as a sweeper, and security guard Ashok, who went inside the sewer to rescue Chandilya. The two were taken to a nearby hospital where they were declared brought dead, reports said.

364.title: 5 injured as tree falls on Ganpati pandal, car in Thane's Kolbad
364.article_body: Five people were injured after a tree fell on a Ganpati pandal and a car in Kolbad in Maharashtra's Thane city amid heavy rains on Friday. According to Regional Disaster Management Cell (RDMC) chief, Avinash Sawant, the incident took place at around 8 pm near Jagmata temple. "Of the five injured, two...sustained serious wounds and are hospitalised," Sawant added.

365.title: Fan gifts Sonu Sood his painting made with blood, actor says 'donate blood instead'
365.article_body: A fan met and gifted Sonu Sood a painting of him made with blood. Reacting to the video of the meeting, the actor tweeted, "Donate blood, my brother, don't waste it by making my painting with blood. Thank you very much." In the video, the fan can be heard saying that he can sacrifice his life for Sood.

366.title: Australia captain Finch retires from ODI cricket after scoring 26 runs in last 7 innings
366.article_body: Australia's white-ball captain Aaron Finch has announced his retirement from ODI cricket. The third Australia-New Zealand ODI on Sunday will be his last ODI. The 35-year-old's decision comes after scoring 26 runs in his last seven innings. Finch has played 145 ODIs, scoring 5,401 runs, including 17 hundreds. "It has been a fantastic ride with some incredible memories," Finch said.

367.title: IMD predicts rain, issues orange alert in Hyderabad till Sunday
367.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert in Hyderabad till Sunday. The city is likely to witness rains that could lead to waterlogging on roads and low-lying areas and cause traffic jams, according to IMD. Water and electricity could be disrupted for a few hours, it added. Notably, Ganesh idol immersions are being undertaken this weekend.

368.title: US President Joe Biden to attend Queen Elizabeth II's funeral
368.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said that he'll attend the funeral of Queen Elizabeth II in Britain. "I don't know the details yet, but I'll be going," Biden told reporters. The date of the funeral has not been confirmed, but it's expected to take place in Westminster Abbey in London on September 19. The Queen died on Thursday aged 96.

369.title: Charles ends his 1st address as King with quote sung at Diana's funeral
369.article_body: King Charles made a reference to a song performed at Princess Diana's funeral as he paid tribute to his mother the Queen on Friday evening. Ending his address, King Charles III said, "May flights of angels sing thee to thy rest." It was a reference to lyrics from Song for Athene, which was performed at Diana's funeral in 1997.

370.title: Said 'can't get film so easily', Anurag said 'Are you mad': Huma on film offer
370.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi said filmmaker Anurag Kashyap told her that he would cast her in a movie when she had first come to Mumbai. "I said, 'I've just come to Bombay. I've heard you have to struggle a lot. You can't get a film so easily.' Then he is like, 'Are you mad?' I am like 'A bit.'," she added.

371.title: 6 die in Haryana's Sonipat, Mahendragarh during Ganesh idol immersion; CM expresses grief
371.article_body: Four people died in Mahendragarh while two others died in Sonipat in Haryana during the Lord Ganesha idol immersion on Friday. Nine youths had been swept away in a canal in Mahendragarh. While four died, others were rescued. Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar expressed his condolences. "We...stand with the families of...deceased in this difficult time," he wrote on Twitter.

372.title: Pilot announces Queen Elizabeth II's death before landing in London, video surfaces
372.article_body: A video of a British Airways pilot making a mid-flight announcement about the death of Queen Elizabeth II has surfaced online. "The Queen passed away earlier today...I thought at the moment I should at least tell you...because I know many will be very, very sad about this," the pilot said 40 minutes before landing at the Heathrow Airport in London.

373.title: Max Verstappen, AlphaTauri's Tsunoda get grid penalties for Italian GP
373.article_body: Red Bull F1 driver Max Verstappen is set to reportedly take another grid penalty during the 2022 Italian GP for changing an engine component. AlphaTauri's Yuki Tsunoda has meanwhile been confirmed to get a 10-place penalty for accumulating reprimands from the race stewards. Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton, Haas' Mick Schumacher and Alfa Romeo's Valtteri Bottas are also taking penalties.

374.title: Liverpool looking to replace Jurgen Klopp with Luis Enrique: Report
374.article_body: Liverpool are reportedly looking to replace manager Jurgen Klopp with Spain national team head coach Luis Enrique emerging as the frontrunner for the post. Liverpool have managed to win only two matches from seven games across all competitions this season. A report claimed Liverpool have already contacted Enrique but Klopp might be given time till January.

375.title: MakeMyTrip announces India’s 15 most-loved homestays of 2022
375.article_body: MakeMyTrip shared that it has released the list of India's Favourite Homestays Awards (IFHA) winners in association with The Times of India. Chosen by 5,00,000+ consumer votes across India and assessed by an expert jury that included Twinkle Khanna, this list of 15 homestays in India is a must-try for your next vacation, said MakeMyTrip.

376.title: ₹32 lakh seized after ED raids on Punjab MLA, others in bank fraud case
376.article_body: The ED on Friday seized hard drives and ₹32 lakh in cash after raiding the premises of Punjab AAP MLA Jaswant Singh Gajjan Majra and others. Raids were conducted on directors of Tara Corporation Limited and their associates in an alleged bank loan fraud. The ED said the accused inflated TCL's turnover through "bogus firms" and siphoned off loan funds.

377.title: India's kharif rice output to fall due to less sowing area: Govt
377.article_body: India's rice production could decrease by around 6.5 million tonnes during this year's Kharif season due to reduction in sowing area, the government said. However, the government asserted there will be surplus output. On Thursday, a ban on exporting broken rice was imposed. Further, export duty of 20% on non-basmati rice was also imposed.

378.title: Direct tax collection rose by 35% this fiscal till Sep 8: IT data
378.article_body: Direct tax collection, which includes personal income tax, increased by 35.46% to ₹6.48 lakh crore in the current financial year till September 8, according to the Income Tax (IT) Department's data. Direct tax collection after net refunds stood at ₹5.29 lakh crore. The country's GDP growth was at 13.5% in the first quarter of this fiscal ending June 30, 2022.

379.title: WHO launching $1.5 billion campaign against meningitis in Africa
379.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) said it is launching a $1.5 billion campaign to eliminate bacterial meningitis across Africa by 2030. WHO Regional Director, Africa, Matshidiso Moeti said "a next generation" vaccine against meningitis will be available in the worst-affected countries. Over 50 million African children had their meningitis vaccinations delayed due to the COVID-19 outbreak.

380.title: Section 144 imposed in J&K's Rajouri due to 'communal tension'
380.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir administration imposed prohibitory orders under Section 144 in Rajouri town on Friday citing “communal tension”. The decision was taken following a group's procession call after Friday prayers over a land dispute. With the order, the assembly of four or more people in public places has been restrained.

381.title: Sweden set for election on Sep 11 amid concerns over energy bills
381.article_body: Sweden is set for Parliamentary elections on Sunday, with rising energy costs due to the Russia-Ukraine war and violent crimes at home being the most-discussed topics. Prime Minister Magdalena Andersson of the Social Democrats currently enjoys a high approval rating. Andersson became Sweden's first female prime minister less than a year ago.

382.title: Chinese shadowing our warships in South China Sea: Australia
382.article_body: Australia's Navy chief Vice Admiral Mark Hammond on Friday said the Chinese Navy's "unusual behaviour" of shadowing Australian warships in South China Sea hadn't deterred operations. "Routinely whenever we have a ship up there, there's a PLA (People's Liberation Army) navy vessel...following us around," he said. Hammond was speaking ahead of next week's multination naval exercise 'Kakadu'.

383.title: EU & Thailand seal partnership deal ending years of strained ties
383.article_body: The European Union (EU) and Thailand sealed a Partnership and Cooperation Agreement (PCA) on Friday, as both sides make efforts to repair relations which were strained following a military coup in Bangkok in 2014. This is the EU's sixth PCA agreement with a Southeast Asian country. The PCA improves bilateral ties on multiple issues, including human rights, and counterterrorism.

384.title: Saba shares dad Mansoor's pic with Queen Elizabeth II, says 'End of an era'
384.article_body: Late Indian cricketer Mansoor Ali Khan Pataudi's daughter Saba Pataudi took to Instagram to share a picture of him with Queen Elizabeth II, who passed away on Thursday. "An end of an Era. R.I.P #queenelizabeth...She'll be remembered. #Lord's #cricket #ground," she wrote. In the picture, Mansoor is seen standing next to the Queen, as she shook hands with other cricketers.

385.title: Former Union Ministers, ex-CMs handed state party roles by BJP
385.article_body: The BJP has announced in-charges, co-in-charges and 'prabharis' for 15 states, including poll-bound northeast states. National General Secretary Tarun Chugh is now the new Telangana 'prabhari', while former Tripura CM Biplab Kumar Deb has been appointed for Haryana. Sambit Patra is the coordinator for northeast states and former I&B minister Prakash Javadekar is the 'prabhari' for Kerala.

386.title: 4 children drown in UP's Aami river during immersion of Ganesh idol
386.article_body: Four children drowned in Aami river in Uttar Pradesh's Sant Kabir Nagar during the immersion of Ganesh idol on Friday, police officials said. The bodies were recovered with the help of fishermen and have been sent for postmortem. The deceased were identified as six-year-old Pauphia, six-year-old Ajit, eight-year-old Ruby and 11-year-old Dipali, Superintendent of Police said.

387.title: King Charles delivers 1st speech as British monarch, says 'My mother was an inspiration'
387.article_body: King Charles III delivered his first speech as Britain's monarch on Friday and paid tribute to his mother Queen Elizabeth II, who passed away aged 96. "Throughout her life...my beloved mother was an inspiration and example to me and...all my family," said Charles. "We owe her the most heartfelt debt any family can owe to their mother," he added.

388.title: I'd love Carlos Alcaraz to win 30 Grand Slams: Coach Juan Carlos
388.article_body: Praising world number four Carlos Alcaraz after he reached his maiden Grand Slam semi-final at US Open, his coach Juan Carlos said, "I'd love for him to win 30 Grand Slams. He has a chance of winning many." He added, "First step is to win the first." The 19-year-old beat 11th-seeded Jannik Sinner in five hours 15 minutes in quarter-final.

389.title: One of the best: Patrick on Alcaraz-Sinner's 5hr 15min US Open quarter-final
389.article_body: Commenting on the quarter-final match between Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner at US Open 2022, Simona Halep's coach Patrick Mouratoglou said it was probably "one of the best matches" he has seen in a long time. Alcaraz beat Sinner 6-3, 6-7(7-9), 6-7(0-7), 7-5, 6-3 in five hours 15 minutes. It was the second-longest match in the history of US Open.

390.title: What is the protocol for internet shutdowns?: SC to Centre
390.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday asked the Centre whether there is a protocol for internet shutdowns. The apex court was hearing a plea which alleged arbitrary internet shutdowns in Arunachal Pradesh, Gujarat, Rajasthan and West Bengal. The SC bench said instead of issuing notices to the four states, notice should be sent to the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology.

391.title: Congress should refuel in BJP states during 'Bharat Jodo': HS Puri
391.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri has "advised" the Congress to refuel their vehicles in BJP-ruled states to save money during the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. "Congress leaders can save around ₹1,050 to ₹2,205 per diesel vehicle while traversing through 12 states- 3,500 km," said Puri's tweet. He tweeted a graphic which claimed that fuel in BJP-ruled states is comparatively cheaper.

392.title: PM Modi discusses energy, climate, blue economy with Norwegian PM
392.article_body: PM Narendra Modi had a telephone conversation with his Norwegian counterpart Jonas Gahr Støre on Friday. They discussed bilateral and international issues including initiatives to mobilise climate finance for renewable energy projects in developing countries. "[They discussed their] cooperation in the fields of...climate...investments and blue economy," the Norwegian Prime Minister's Office said.

393.title: Sri Lanka defeat Pakistan in Super 4 stage ahead of their Asia Cup 2022 final
393.article_body: Sri Lanka defeated Pakistan by five wickets in the last Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match. Put into bat first, Pakistan were dismissed for 121, with Sri Lanka spinner Wanindu Hasaranga registering bowling figures of 4-0-21-3. Sri Lanka chased down the target in 17 overs, with their opener Pathum Nissanka scoring an unbeaten 55 off 48 deliveries.

394.title: Pakistan rehire Matthew Hayden as mentor for T20 World Cup
394.article_body: The Pakistan Cricket Board has rehired former Australia cricketer Matthew Hayden as the team mentor for the ICC T20 World Cup in Australia. Hayden had an earlier stint with Pakistan during last year's T20 World Cup in UAE. "I welcome Matthew Hayden...He is a proven performer with his credentials acknowledged and recognised world-over," said PCB Chairman Ramiz Raja.

395.title: Last year was very new experience, balancing was difficult: Neeraj Chopra
395.article_body: Olympic gold medallist Neeraj Chopra said commercial obligations and social commitments took a toll on him last year but he has learnt from his experience. "Last year was a very new experience for me, balancing was difficult," said Chopra. He added that during the off-season he worked on his technique, which helped him win the Diamond League final.

396.title: What are Kohli and Sachin's all-format stats after 71 international hundreds?
396.article_body: Virat Kohli on Thursday smashed his 71st hundred in his 522nd innings in international cricket. Sachin Tendulkar had reached 71 international hundreds in 523 innings. Kohli scored 24,002 runs in his first 522 innings in international cricket, while Sachin had aggregated 23,274 runs in his first 523 innings. Kohli's average after 71 international hundreds is 53.81, while Sachin's was 49.51.

397.title: India already united: Anurag Thakur on Cong's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
397.article_body: Criticising the Congress over 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Friday said India is already united under PM Narendra Modi's leadership. "The double-engine (BJP) government in both the Centre and State has worked together to take the state and country forward," Thakur said. "We can't let the country get divided and must work with unity," he added.

398.title: My English has improved but is not very good yet: Neeraj Chopra
398.article_body: Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra, who became the first Indian to win Diamond Trophy on Thursday, said his English has improved but isn't "very good" yet. "However...I've learnt it to a point where I understand what others want to say...make others understand what I want to say. Athletics is a global sport & knowing basics help," he added.

399.title: India's WC-winning captains Dhoni, Kapil Dev watch US Open match together, pic viral
399.article_body: India's World Cup-winning captains MS Dhoni and Kapil Dev were spotted watching Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner's US Open men's quarter-final match. Reacting to video that surfaced online showing Dhoni and Kapil watching the match at Arthur Ashe Stadium, a fan tweeted, "They're being identified and getting roars even in US." Kapil also shared a picture of him with Dhoni.

400.title: Sabalenka wears sunglasses at press conference to hide tears after losing US Open semi
400.article_body: World number six Aryna Sabalenka wore sunglasses and a cap at the press conference to hide her tears after losing the US Open women's singles semi-final against world number one Iga Swiatek. The 24-year-old lost the semi-final with a scoreline of 6-3, 1-6, 4-6. "Can't begin to imagine how horrible she feels," a fan tweeted.

401.title: Appreciate Rahul Gandhi’s endeavours: Meghalaya Governor Malik
401.article_body: Meghalaya governor Satya Pal Malik praised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi saying he "appreciates his endeavours" and said he "hoped" the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' will "have some good outcomes for the country". Malik added that the nation's security will be impacted if "its military and farmers were not strong". He also criticised the renaming of Delhi's Rajpath to 'Kartavya Path'.
